loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Dauda is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mika joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bala, Hosea and Nuhu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mika would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mika can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mika  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

texts.en: Michael Amadu is a maize farmer from Kyasge village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Michael Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Michael Amadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Michael Amadu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 34-year-old married father of four children who has worked in his bakery since 18 years to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He lives in a poor village in Lebanon. 

Abbass is trying desperately to expand his business. Thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy bakery materials that he needs to improve his ability to satisfy his customers with better and quicker service.

Abbass hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's financial and social conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary bakery materials

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Yecenia   de 42 años  de edad es casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos   en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de tortillas  y medicina, su negocio está ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Yecenia sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad y aldeas aledañas, es una mujer emprendedora que tiene ganas de salir adelante junto con su familia.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de medicinas, maíz, leña y cal. ya que quiere ampliar su pequeño negocio de medicinas y tener la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo su calidad de vida.
 Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Yecenia is 42 years old and is married.  She lives with her husband and her children in her home, and she has worked for the past ten years selling tortillas and medicines.  Her business is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. 

Yecenia notes that her customers are friends and neighbors in her community and surrounding villages.  She is a hard-working woman who has a desire to get ahead along with her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase medicine, corn, firewood and lime.  She wants to grown her small medicine business and have the raw materials necessary for making tortillas. With the help of this loan she will increase her income and above all her quality of life. 

Her dream is to improve her business.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  November, 2014

loans.use: to purchase medicine, corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Wendell

texts.en:
Wendell, 33, is married with a child and is settled for a living at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He and his wife manage their own business for a living. It is doing well. He had a better income from this and was able to buy a secondhand vehicle used for a transportation services business.

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to repair a transport vehicle used in their transportation business.

He wants to have a comfortable house and an improved living situation for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his transportation business.

loans.name: Mwaperu

texts.en:
Mwaperu is married and has three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past two years, Mwaperu has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

Mwaperu wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of varieties of fruits to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of varieties of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ellena

texts.en:
Ma. Ellena is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Ellena has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

Ma. Ellena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman but has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over a year, Mwanamisi has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Mwanamisi wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Florence has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Humble and hardworking – that’s Peris. She is a real fighter of a woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her five children. Her primary sources of income are milk, vegetables and farming. Peris hails from Nyamira, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. Peris, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Peris has always ensured putting food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. Peris detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 41,600 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. The improved cash flow means that profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. Through your loan, Peris will be empowered economically and will be able to improve her standard of living and those of people living within the area. Peris is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over six years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of three children, all adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses  are household consumables.

For over six years, Mwanamisi has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business. 

Mwanamisi wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn has been farming for many years, and she earns better income from this. With her previous loan, used to pay for weeding and maintenance costs, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds to have a productive harvest.

She wants to expand her farm and use her profit to renovate their house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds to have a productive harvest.

loans.name: Marina Mercedes

texts.es: Marina,  tiene 55 años de edad y es madre de una hijo de 28 años.  Adquirió su experiencia como confeccionista de ropa, en su anterior empleo en el que estuvo por 10 años trabajando. Ella  tiene 34 años de experiencia en esta labor y con esta amplia trayectoria ha logrado una amplia clientela,  conformada por sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, a quienes les confecciona ropa femenina y también presta servicio de arreglo de vestidos.  Todos los días, sus clientes pueden acceder a sus servicios y no tiene horario de atención. Sus compras las realiza a almacenes textiles de contado, así mismo sus ventas son canceladas de contado, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una maquina industrial, para tener mayor cobertura.  Esta inversión mejorará la calidad de sus productos, por lo que sus clientes estarán más satisfechos. Su desafío a nivel familiar, ha sido ser madre cabeza de familia y no tener el suficiente apoyo económico, pero aun sus metas familiares están direccionadas en el apoyo económicamente e incondicional a su hijo y nietas, por eso desea renovar las maquinas de su negocio, para lograr a futuro una mayor competitividad en el mercado.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old and is the mother of one son of 28 years. She acquired her experience as a clothing manufacturer in her previous job where she had worked for 10 years.  She has 34 years of experience in this work and with this extensive experience has acquired a large clientele including her friends, neighbors, and relatives.  She manufactures female clothes and also provides clothing alternation services for her clients. Every day, her clients can access her services - purchases are made at a textiles store by cash, and likewise cancelled sales are handled in cash. 

She is applying for her first kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the money from the loan she will purchase an industrial sewing machine in order to have greater capacity.  This investment will improve the quality of her products so that her customers will be more satisfied.

Her challenge in the family has been being a mother head of household and not having enough financial support.  Be that as it may, her family goals are also addressed by financial and unconditional support from her son and granddaughters.  She desires to update her equipment to achieve greater future market competitiveness.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all attending school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Fatuma has operated a clothing and shoe sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition and seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Fatuma wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a widowed mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over eight years, Saumu has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Saumu wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is divorced, with three children, all adults .She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.  

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to have access to loans to boost her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman; she has six children, four of whom attend school while two are still young. Mesaid owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaid has operated a firewood business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators.
 
Mesaid wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, the above photo presents Roseline, who is 40 years of age and a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. 

She is based in Keera, a remote village in Nyamira. It is harsh living because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married, and, together with her husband, she has three lovely children. 

Roseline is a tough woman with tough skin, and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

The Nyamira area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Roseline has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow, but the lack of capital has prevented her. 

She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Nyamira area is high, but the supply is low. So through this loan, Roseline is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand. 

Her increased income will allow Roseline to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. 

Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: To buy a quality exotic breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has two children, both attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mejumaa operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Mejumaa's dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

Mejumaa plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has four children, all attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasiti operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

Mwanasiti wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза очень трудолюбивая женщина, которая радуется каждому дню. У Хафизы также как и ее мужа нет высшего образования. Они  имеют 3-их маленьких детей. Муж Хафизы работает в колхозе трактористом. Сама Хафиза домохозяйка. Смотрит за огромным хозяйством и воспитывает троих детей. У Хафизы также имеется крупно рогатый скот. Она ухаживает за ними,  а молоком полученным от скота кормит своих детей. Сейчас Хафиза хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить численность скота. Хафиза заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Hafiza is a very hardworking woman who enjoys every day of her life.  Neither she nor her husband have a higher education, but they are the parents of three young children.  Her husband works on a farm as a tractor driver.  Hafiza herself is a homemaker: she takes care of her large home and raises her children.  She also owns some cattle.  She takes care of her farm animals and uses the milk from her cows to feed her children. She is currently taking a loan to increase her cattle headcount.  She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support, and is looking forward to a positive outlook.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of two children, both attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over eight years, Hadija has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Hadija wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Dianne

texts.en:
Diane is 40 years old and married, with four children, ages between 8 and 21 years, all of them in school.  

She sells foodstuffs and has been in her business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and potatoes to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has six children, all attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Asha operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Asha wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married, but has no children. She lives at her own house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and she has been blessed with one child. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Fatuma has operated a fish-selling business for over 20 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 40,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widow and she has five children, all attending school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mwanasiti has operated a fish sales business for over 20 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality, transportation and perishability leading to losses.

Mwanasiti wants to use this 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and paraffin. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has been blessed with  one child who has completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of adding more dairy cows and diversifying to a motorcycle business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed

loans.name: Boylin

texts.en:
Boylin is very dedicated to his studies and  wants to become successful in the future. He studies Deck watch keeping  in a university. His parents earn income from their business. He has six siblings living with his family. 

Boylin borrowed this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying his school tuition fee for the second semester. In the future, he wants to find a job that will enable him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Thôn 6 - Đông Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Thắng is 54 years old, and she is married with four children.  She is the group leader of the nhóm 11 - thôn 6 - đông thịnh solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

Thắng operates a food stall/restaurant selling cakes. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to make cakes for sale.  The main hardship that Thắng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Lalekye

texts.en:
Lalekye is married with four school going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes selling business for four years now, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

For this loan, she is requesting 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES). She wants to purchase bales of ladies' clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of ladies' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman. She has been blessed with one child who does not attend school because he is an adult. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food

Mebakari operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has three children, all attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mishi operates a green grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

Mishi wants to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married and has three children, all attending school. Esha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esha operates a firewood sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators.
 
Esha wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase stocks of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of firewood for resale

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi, aged 46 years, is married and has been blessed with seven school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Iddi has operated a dairy farming business, selling at retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Iddi dreams of adding more dairy cows and expanding to a motorcycle business. 

Iddi wants to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase cow feed and medicine for livestock. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cow feed and medicine for livestock

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena is a married woman  and they have eight children, of whom six attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling retail to local customers. Flomena cites high cost of transportation as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a motorcycle for distributing coconuts in the near future.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase five sacks of coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a hard-working farmer who is living in Molave-Guitran, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has an area for vegetable gardening and she has been in the business for 20 years to help sustain the needs of her family. 

However, because she wanted to have a good harvest of vegetables, she took out a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer. This help means a lot to Florita.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for her vegetable garden to sustain the needs of the family.

loans.name: Neil Jayson

texts.en:
Neil Jayson is a very dedicated student who wants to become successful in the future. He is studying deck watchkeeping (ship operations) at a university. His parents were earning an income from their business that was able to support the family and Neil Jayson's studies. He has five siblings. 

Neil Jayson borrowed this loan from GDMPC  to pay tuition fees for the second semester. In the future, he wants to become successful with his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Karen is 32 years old and all of her children attend school.

Karen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Karen has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are fees and food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dorcas dreams of establishing a wholesale cereal shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school; the other two are still young. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Mwanaidi operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is married woman with two children, who are still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Kheggie

texts.en: Kheggie is a very dedicated son who wants to become successful in the future. He studies a Marine Course in a university. His parents are both busy with their tailoring services business. He has seven siblings living with his family. He borrowed this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying school tuition fees for the second semester. In the future, he would like to find a better job according to his desire.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 62 years old and married with 12 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lourdes is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional income as a fishpond operator and from raising pigs. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 45,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell through her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell through her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, with neighbours and town dwellers as clients. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence leading to losses of perishable goods.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 39 years old. She is married with four children between 6 and 18 years old and all of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, cassava and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cassava and bananas to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase building materials to finish building her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to finish building her shop

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 57 years old and has 11 children. Nenita is married and three of her children are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married women with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality and delayed payments as the challenges in the business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, beans, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a married woman with one child, who is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of slow payment for goods taken on credit. With the KES 50,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman and has been blessed with nine children, of whom two attend school and the other seven have completed schooling. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with two lovely children. She is a youthful 32-year-old woman and a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nyamira, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Roseline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family and is always ready to get what her family needs.

Working in the field is one of the most difficult jobs today because of the amount of effort needed to make progress; however, Roseline has done well despite the weather or the circumstances surrounding her. For the past fourteen years her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. She also runs a posho mill as a side business to supplement the meager income she earns from farming.

Roseline lives in a remote village that has poor feeder roads, so it is hard for her to get her produce to market quickly and efficiently. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. But because of her distance from the market, she has suffered many losses.

This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. So she has mobilized other woman in her village to join Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a 180,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike, which will enable her to quickly transport more goods to market. She also intends to employ someone to drive the motorbike and help her in farm work.

The benefits of this loan will be astronomical in that Roseline will seldom suffer losses due to delays in delivery. More fresh produce to market will mean an increase in her income.

Finding a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Roseline is relieved to know that Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva are there to help women make a change for themselves and others in the community. Through such institutions women can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts.

Roseline looks forward to improving her living conditions and assuring her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future. Through this loan she is going to achieve these dreams.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her produce from the countryside to market

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Hello Lenders! Meet Margaret, a mother of seven who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Margaret is a hardworking farmer from Igare Village in the Kisii area of Kenya. She is a committed wife. She has been doing mixed farming for the last 10 years and her main income sources are milk, eggs and crops. She is also engaged in other personal businesses. Margaret enjoys dairy farming, especially milking cows. She is contented with the farming way of life. Her ambition is to generate more income and take better care of the people who she looks after. Her main challenge is ensuring the proper health status of her animals. She says this takes a lot of commitment and attention. Margaret is requesting a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. Dairy cows, over the years, have provided her a means of being self-sufficient. Now, with your loan, Margaret will get more dairy products from her cows, which will bring her extra income to keep up with her rising family expenses. She acknowledges that keeping a dairy cow is a big commitment that needs careful preparation but she knows she is up for the task and she is going to do it big.

loans.use: To purchase a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and has four children. With three children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but she has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

With this in mind Marites has applied for a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home. She is committed to restoring her family’s devastated life.

In the future Marites would like to have saved enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs including maize flour, cereals, and cooking fat, to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned high costs and seasonality as her major challenges. Purity dreams of establishing a wholesale shop, in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase various goods to sell, including cereals, maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil and soap. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air, food-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman, and she has seven children, all of whom attend school. Sidi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sidi has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other fuel sellers, in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Phylister

texts.en:
Phylister is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids. Her children attend school. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Phylister operates a poultry-selling business, work she has been doing for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak, causing losses, as a challenge in the business. Phylister dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Priscar is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With this loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with four children who all attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, Binti has operated a coconut-selling business, selling as retail to her local customers. She cites the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a motorcycle for distributing coconuts in the near future for resale. She is requesting a 50,000 KES loan. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for distributing coconuts in the near future for resale.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, making school uniforms and suits for both men and women. Her challenge in the business is seasonality. She dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for the business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 42 years old. She is married with three children between 11 and 18 years old, all of whom go to school. She sells vegetables and has been in this business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is married and has three childen, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Damaris has operated a door-to-door motorcycle transport business. She also raises chickens and sells them to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her main business challenge is the high cost of operating her motorcycle.

Damaris has decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and so improve her living standards. With a 45,000 KES loan she will buy another motorcycle and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle and add to her savings.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married mother of five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Selina has operated a retail shop for the past three years. She sells household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a widow with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Kasichana has been operating a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kahonzi

texts.en:
Kahonzi is married with 7 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, cereals, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, cereals, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Scolar

texts.en:
Scolar is a married and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the six months, she has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. Scolar dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future. With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase tomatoes, vegetables and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, vegetables and onions to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides. She is now taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds to have a productive harvest. 

She is now happy to say that with this loan, the entire farm will be improved and she is rest assured for a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds to have a productive harvest.

loans.name: Tufaa

texts.en:
Tufaa is a married woman and has three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and students at a neighboring school. In addition she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café in the business.

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sound equipment, televisions and clothes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future.

With this loan that she is requesting of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwake

texts.en:
Mwake is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and lives together with her husband and two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. With this loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es:
Rita es una persona humilde que vive en san miguel provincia de bolívar en la comunidad pucara, pertenece a la ventanilla rural la nueva esperanza, ella no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que mantener a sus cinco hijos, es madre soltera y solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y frejol para luego sembrar y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada ocho días su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas y así no arrendar. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y atender a sus hijos, le gusta el carnaval y la navidad que son costumbres de su comunidad en donde puede realizar trabajos extras y obtener más dinero para sus hijos.
texts.en: Rita is a humble person who lives in San Miguel, province of Bolívar, in the Pucara community. She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza rural bank. She doesn't have a stable job and she has to support her five children. She is a single mother and she is asking for the loan to buy corn and bean seeds to pater plant and obtain a good yield to pay for her family's expenses. She makes her purchases in San Pablo every eight days. Her dream is to buy herself a plot of land to plant more and not have to rent. In her free time, she likes to watch television and tend to her children. She likes carnival and Christmas which are traditional in her community, and when she can do extra work and make more money for her children.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 19-year-old single lady from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a humble house in the city. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.

Eman is a student in a local college, where she studies Computer Programming. She would like to earn the BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family and improve their living conditions.

Eman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. She will be able to do her homework using special programs.

Eman appears in the photo in her college.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 32-year-old woman, from Tskaltubo district. She lives with her parents, brother and his family. Khatuna's father is a private artisan and her brother is a military person. Both generate 300-400 GEL monthly. In order to make her bit to the family's welfare, Khatuna started to work as a nurse, taking care of a child and generating 250 GEL monthly. However, her income isn't enough to meet all the basic needs and cover everyday expenses. So Khatuna made a decision to get another source of income and requested a loan. 

The start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to start or re-start their own businesses. So, Khatuna plans to purchase a stock of cosmetics and perfumes and sell them in her free time, in her community. She will buy products at wholesale prices, and will sell them with price mark-ups. The new business initiative will give her a chance to tackle the financial difficulties and increase her monthly income. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be capable of expanding her business that covers almost all of her customers' needs. Khatuna awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start a trading business with cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción 42  años  de edad,   vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 7 años al negocio de venta de golosinas, pan y tamales, su venta es de forma ambulante y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario visita y que le visitan en su casa.
 Doña Asunción es una mujer trabajadora que desea salir adelante y es un ejemplo de trabajo y de superación en la comunidad.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de plátanos, papas, harina, maíz, leña, aceite, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es su noveno  préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es mejor su  negocio. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asuncion is 42 years old; she lives with her husband and three daughters in her home. For seven years she has been selling sweets, bread and tamales. She is a street vendor and her customers are her friends and people who she visits daily and who come to her house.

Mrs. Asuncion is a hard working woman who wants to move ahead and is an example of hard work and self-improvement in the community.

She is requesting this loan to buy plantains, potatoes, flour, corn, firewood, oil, etc. With the help from this loan she plans to improve her business and thus improve her quality of life. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma and this is the ninth loan that she is requesting.

Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014.

loans.use: to buy plantains, potatoes, flour, corn, firewood, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Saday

texts.en:
Saday is 20 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli City, now is living in Fuzuli region. He is single and is living with his parents and two sisters. After the military, he decided to continue in their family business, and since then he has been in the animal breeding business. He loves animals and his work. 

Today Saday needs a loan in amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy vaccinations for the animals. He says great thanks to Kiva organization for the loan. Saday is engaged, and he wants to increase his business and monthly income, because in the future he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy vaccinations for his animals, and increase his business.

loans.name: Jose Hermites

texts.en: Jose Hermites is responsible and dedicated to his work as a security guard. This is his only source of income, and he is very grateful for it because this is how he supports his two children. He has applied for a loan to cover the cost of renewing his security guard license. His goal is to continue to work in this field so he can support his family.

loans.use: to renew his security guard license.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a hardworking 38-year-old farmer from Igare Village in the Kisii area of Kenya. She is a mother to four cute children. Jane has been doing mixed farming for five years, with tea farming and milk being her main sources of income. Jane has always had a proclivity for livestock farming. She keeps a few sheep that provide her with home-grown meat and wool. However, the sheep milk market is not open in Kenya. For this reason, Jane is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow and insure it. The cow will produce milk that will be used for consumption and sales. The money she makes from the milk sales will be used to repay the loan and pay for other personal purchases. With your loan, Jane will realize a significant increase in milk production. The acquisition of the cow will boost the sales volume and profits alike. This whole investment will bring a sense of self-sufficiency and food security to her family.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Her name is Joan. She is 45, and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, a driver, and has three children. One is in college, and two are in elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Joan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store, which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, vegetables, processed meats, charcoal, soda, and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Joan hopes to maintain and grow her business, so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 26 years old. She is married with one child who is eight months old, not yet going to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and trousers to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers to resell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a widowed mother with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation of goods to her place of business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, omena and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, omena and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en: Yazgul is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person who lives in the Fuzuli region with her beautiful children. Her husband left her and their two children and does not help them, so she is raising her children by herself. After repaying her first loan on time, Yazgul is now requesting a second loan for 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). She will use it to make pickles, sweets, jam and and other items to sell during the holiday season. She is very grateful for the assistance she is receiving from Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare more food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college expenses for this semester.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old and single, from Nablus city. He lives with his mother in a humble house in the city. His mother works as an employee in a local firm, where she gets a low income. 

Mohammad is a student in a local university, where he studies nursing. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to help his family and improve its living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  He will be able to do his homework and read more articles online.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
Gani is married, and he has four children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old. They live in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Gani and his family have had a difficult time.  After the war his house was burned, and they were left without a home or many of their belongings. 

Gani is always positive and grateful and considers himself lucky that he was able to obtain donations to build a new home. He is a hardworking man, striving even in difficult times to give his family everything they need. 

As the main source of income, he works very hard and from early morning until late night. He has land that he cultivates and harvests different vegetables for his family to use and to sell. This allows them to eat healthy, save money, and have income. 

Now he needs a loan in order to purchase a new tractor to work on the land.  His current tractor is worn out and damaged from years of use. This is his first time asking for a loan, and he is very excited about the opportunity and grateful for the assistance. 

His goal is to give his children a better education.  He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a new tractor to work his land

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 61 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling tomatoes in the Philippines. Virginia has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy more tomatoes to sell. She has been in this line of work for ten years, and her goal for the future is to build up and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a farmer from Kirogine village in central Kenya. Dairy farming thrives in this area. Crop farming is also practiced even though the climate can be hot and dry for a very long period. 

Martha enjoys the support of her 54-year-old husband when going about her farm business, which she has been doing for more than two decades. Their primary income sources from the farm are milk, eggs, maize, bananas, and vegetables. Martha also has a side business that keeps money coming. 

She is seeking a small loan to purchase water pipes and a water tank. She has always experienced problems keeping her animals hydrated during dry seasons. With your loan, Martha will have water during dry seasons, which she will have "harvested'"during the few months with rain. 

Combined with the stored fodder, her livestock will be sufficiently fed during the dry season from the comfort of their stable. This investment will bring food security to her family and profits to go to her children's education. 

All that Martha waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy water pipes and a water tank

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 44 years old and married, with four children, ages between 12 and 21 years, all of them in school.  

She sells soft drinks and has been in her business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy Fanta and juice for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy Fanta and juice for sale.

loans.name: Gulbadam

texts.ru: Гулбадам 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Гулбадам среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 4 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гулбадам, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 0,55 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, где она выращивает картофель, клевер и персиковый сад для реализации оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный доход Гулбадам составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита Гулбадам планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en: Gulbadam is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  For the past four years, she has been growing crops and raising livestock in order to provide her family with an additional source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work and dedication, she currently owns 0.55 hectare of land and she also rents another plot measuring one hectare.  She grows potatoes and clover, and she has a few peach trees.  She sells her produce to bulk buyers.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a heifer.  Gulbadam is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.  She also wants to give her children a decent education.

loans.use: to purchase one heifer in order to increase her profits and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
La señora Venancia  de 51  años de edad,  no tiene   hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad del San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y refrescos.
Doña Venancia sus clientes son los estudiantes, personas que a diario le visitan, familiares y amigos, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra  de  frescos, jugos y huevos con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio porque tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes para esta época de navidad.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Venancia is 51 years old and has no dependent children. She lives with her husband in their own home, located in a community in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. For the last 5 years, she has had a business selling basic groceries and drinks. 

Doña Venancia's clients are students, daily visitors, family and friends. She is a hard-working woman with dreams of helping her family get ahead in life. She is requesting this loan to buy soft drinks, juice and eggs, and with the help of this loan she hopes to improve her income and her business, since she'll have more products to offer to her clients during the Christmas season. 

Her dream is to improve her business and her life.

loans.use: to buy juice, soft drinks and eggs for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives in Tukuran, where she runs a grocery store in which she sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has been in this line of work for years, and is very committed to generating income so that she can provide for her family and improve its living situation. Jocelyn has requested this loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and grains to sell in her store so that she can increase sales. Her goal for the future is to repair her house so her family has a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nakale

texts.en:
Nakale is married, with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Nakale has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators.
 
With the KES 50,000. she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es: Manuel tiene 36 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura ya que no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que solventar a su familia que consta de sus cuatro hijos y su mujer. Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar frejol y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza porque no estudio y no tiene una profesión pero sale adelante gracias a la agricultura. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente,le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 36, is a farmer because he does not have a stable job, and he has to support his family.  He has four children and a wife.  He lives in the San Miguel province of Bolívar in the Pucara community.
