He is requesting the loan to buy organic compost and fertilizers in order to start planting beans and to get a good production.  This is his only business activity because he did not go to school and does not have a profession.  However, he gets ahead thanks to agriculture.

He makes his purchases every 15 days in San Pablo because there is not frequent transportation.  He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Kanadzin

texts.en:
Kanadzin is married and the mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water and electricity. 

Kanadzin has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Muhamvi

texts.en:
Muhamvi is married, with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business. 

She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and the mother of one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, inició su negocio de venta de almuerzos y bebidas  hace dos años con ayuda de su cónyuge; ellos inicialmente solo vendían almuerzos, pero  los clientes les sugirieron vender también bebidas y por eso decidieron ofrecer estos productos. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, a quienes ofrece cervezas y comida desde su casa, de contado al por mayor y al detal. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual estará invirtiendo en la compra de bebidas, pues considera que incrementar su inventario le permitirá ofrecer un mejor precio, además de que sus compras las realiza a proveedores de contado y necesita para ello capital de trabajo, lo cual beneficiará, teniendo en cuenta que sus ventas se originan de contado y que podrá obtener una fácil recuperación de la inversión. Carlos atiende todos los días, en el horario de 8 a.m.  a  6:00 p.m; él tiene 65 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos de  33 y 26 años y 2 hijas de 40 y 38 años, y sueña con tener una casa en el barrio donde actualmente reside.  Su meta a largo plazo es tener un local que también le sirva de bodega, pero su mayor desafío es incrementar sus ventas y a eso es justamente a lo que le apunta.
texts.en:
Carlos started his business selling lunches and drinks two years ago with the help of his partner. They originally only sold lunches, but then their clients suggested that they also sell drinks and therefore they decided to offer those products as well. Their main clients are neighbors and friends, to whom they offer beer and food from their home, both individually and in bulk. 

They are currently applying for a CrediKiva as their first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which they will use to buy drinks, as they believe it is necessary to boost their inventory so that they can offer better prices. They have to buy from providers in cash, so they need working capital. This is a benefit, since sales are also made in cash so it will allow them to easily recover their investment. Carlos runs the business every day from 8am-6pm; he is 65 years old and has two sons, 33 and 26, and two daughters, 40 and 38. He dreams of having a home of his own in the neighborhood where he is currently living. His long-term goal is to have a separate space that serves as a store, but his greatest challenge is to boost sales, so this is what he's focused on.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his school work.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 37 years old and married, with five children, ages between 9 and 18 years, all of them in school.  

She sells foodstuffs and has been doing her business for 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy potatoes and cassava to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cassava to resell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Anna. The 65-year-old mother of two is a small-holder farmer based in Cheptungei village, found in the North Rift region of Kenya. The secondary-educated entrepreneur runs a mixed-farm, where she keeps two fairly productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale. 

Anna started farming in 1995. She farms on a 2-acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have little to do with agriculture. She was doing it for subsistence, but recently switched it to commercial produce. 

The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status and enabled her to afford her children a better education at standard private schools. Anna has one employee to help her run the farm when she is attending her day job or doing her side job, which involves selling second-hand clothes for extra income. 

Anna is seeking a loan to purchase animal feed. She places more premiums on animal health and nutrition in her dairy business than on other factors. Animal feed has a lot to do with the proper composition of the animal products she sells to her customers. 

She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that the animals require. 

The returns from this investment will enable Anna to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Sunilda Janeth

texts.es:
La señora  Sunilda de 19  años de edad,  tiene 01 hijo y vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Sunilda se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de tortillas y de ropa,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de maíz, leña, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, etc. espera tener la suficiente mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus productos y aprovechar a tener producto para la temporada navideña.
Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos, su sueño  es salir adelante con su hijo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Sunilda is 19 years old, has one child and lives with her husband in their home, located in a community in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. For the last 3 years, Doña Sunilda has worked selling tortillas and clothing. She is an entrepreneurial woman with dreams of getting ahead, and is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood, blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, etc. She hopes to have enough merchandise to meet the demand for her products and to take advantage of the Christmas season to stock up. 

With the help of this loan she will be able to improve her income. Her dream is to get ahead in life, along with her son.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, blouses, pants, dresses and shirts for her businesses

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La Señora  Valentina    de 59 años de edad es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos  que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y  se dedica a la actividad de venta de pan como rosquillas, quesadillas, hojaldras, etc. desde hace  20 años, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido y su buena amabilidad.
Doña Valentina vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, es una mujer  emprendedora dedicada  a su familia y su negocio, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, leche, huevos, etc. material para  elaboración  de sus panes.
Doña Valentina con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir un poco su negocio, su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen y mantener más  amplio su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Valentina is 59 years old and is a single mother who lives with her dependent children. She has her own home, and for the last 20 years has worked selling bread products like donuts, quesadillas, puff pastries, etc. Her clients prefer her because of the variety of products she offers and her friendliness. 

Doña Valentina lives in a community in southern Honduras and is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her family and her business. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood, milk, eggs, and other materials to make her breads. 

With the help of this loan, Doña Valentina will improve her income and will be able to offer more products at her business. Her dream is that her children will graduate and that she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, milk, eggs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Aimkan

texts.ru: Айымкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам. Сейчас в хозяйстве Айымкан есть 2 теленка, а на участке мерою 0,25 ГА она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айымкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Aimkan successfully paid off her last loan after using it for its intended purpose.  She's grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped finance her loan.  Aimkan currently has two calves on her farm, as well as 0.25 hectares of land for growing potatoes and rice, and earns roughly 10,000 som per month.  This time around, she's seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy some livestock, and plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: buy livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Meydin Celenia

texts.es:
La señora Meydin de 28 años de edad está casada, vive con esposo y sus hijos   que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y  se dedica al negocio de venta de rosquilla, hojaldras, quesadillas actividad  que realiza desde hace 9 años, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido y su buena amabilidad.
Meydin vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a su familia y su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para mejora de vivienda desea comprar arena, grava, cemento, ladrillos, varillas, etc. material para construcción,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es tener su bonita su vivienda y más amplio su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Meydin is 28 years old, married, and lives with her husband and dependent children. She has her own home. She has had a business for 9 years selling doughnuts, fry bread, and quesadillas. Her customers prefer her business for her good supply of food and her friendliness.

Meydin lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman dedicated to her family and business. She seeks a loan to improve her home. She wishes to buy sand, gravel, cement, bricks, iron bars, etc., materials to be used in construction. With the support of this loan she intends to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Her dream is to make her home pretty and expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, bricks, iron bars, etc. for her home.

loans.name: Cesar Patricio

texts.es: Cesar tiene 25 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales. Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para sembrar frejol y comprar unos dos puercos para engordarles y luego venderles. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus padres que ya son mayores, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old. He farms and raises animals. He lives in San Miguel province in Bolivar in the Pucara community. He seeks a loan to buy organic manure and fertilizers in order to plant beans and to buy some pigs to fatten and then sell. He makes his purchases in San Pablo every 15 days as there is not frequent transportation. His dream is to help his parents be comfortable as they are now older. He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rita María de 39 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y su madre  que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y su vehículo para trabajar se dedica desde hace 8 años al negocio de venta de rosquilla, hojaldras, quesadillas, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido y su buena amabilidad.
Doña Rita María vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de maíz, manteca, dulce, leña, cuajada, etc. para poder elaborar sus productos con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir un poco su negocio.
Su sueño es tener su negocio más grande.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014
texts.en:
Rita María is a 39 year old single mother. She has five children and her mother who depend on her. She has her own home and vehicle. For 8 years she has had a business selling doughnuts, fry bread, and quesadillas. Her customers prefer her products for her well-stocked business and her friendliness.

Rita Maria lives in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman dedicated to her family. She seeks a loan to buy corn, butter, candy, firewood, cheese, etc. in order to be able to make her products. With the support of this loan she will improve her income and better stock her business.

Her dream is to have a bigger business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, butter, candy, firewood, cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is the 34-year-old married father of two childre.  He has worked as a furniture maker for 18 years to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family.

Ahmad is a hardworker who is trying desperately to satisfy his children's increasing needs. Thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. 

He hopes to build up a better life for his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is 22 years old and single, from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a humble house in the city.  Her father is a worker where he gets a low and unstable income. 

Niveen is a student at a local college, where she studies beauty care and hair dressing. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family and improve its living conditions.

Niveen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay college expenses for this semester. This will help her to complete her study faster and open her own salon in the city.

Niveen appears in the photo at her college.

loans.use: to pay college expenses for this semester

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 48 years old. She is married, with four children, ages between 16 and 30 years, one of them still in school.  

She has a shop and has been in her business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and soap to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and soap to resell.

loans.name: Tania Jessica

texts.es:
Tania es una persona humilde que vive en san miguel provincia de bolívar eno cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que mantener a sus cuatro hijos, es madre soltera  y vive con los padres y su hijo de 5 años.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y cerdos para engordarles y luego verderlos para así solventar los gastos de su familia ya que necesitan para en diario vivir. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada ocho días su sueño es tener una casa propia. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y atender a su hijo, le gusta el carnaval y la navidad que son costumbres de su comunidad en donde puede realizar trabajos extras y obtener más dinero para su  familia.
texts.en:
Tania is a humble person who lives in San Miguel province in Bolivar. She has steady work and has to support her four children. She is a single mother and lives with her parents and her 5 year old son.

She seeks a loan to buy chickens and pigs to fatten and then sell in order to be able to pay her family's daily expenses. She makes her purchases in San Pablo every eight days. She has a dream of owning her own home.

In her free time she enjoys watching television and taking care of her son. She likes carnival and Christmas which are customs in her community where she can do extra work and obtain more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Her name is Cristina, who is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Henry, a technician, and the mother to her three children, of whom one is in high school and the other two in elementary school. Together with her husband, she manages their household.  She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and school needs of her children.

Cristina has made and sold peanut butter and coco jam for two years already. These sandwich spreads are a favorite of the ordinary Filipino household. She sells it per order and on demand as gifts on special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue with her  business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy raw ingredients, such as peanuts, sugar, coconut, and plastic containers needed in her business. She is positive for a good turnout of her business, especially this Christmas season.

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Cristina hopes to grow her business. She aims to send her children to a good school until college. She prays that they will stay happy and united as a family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for peanuts, sugar, and coconut to make peanut butter spread and coco jam to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and married, with six dependents. Three of them are still attending school. 

She runs a sari-sari (or variety) store, selling basic merchandise like powdered milk, cooking oil, eggs, soap, coffee, sugar, biscuits, bread, and seasonings. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now.  Together with her family, she lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. Her husband's occupation is a tuba (coconut) wine gatherer, which they sell to have additional income. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks, like canned goods and beverages, and also materials for renovation of her store.  Amalia will be able to fill her store with a variety of merchandise and also improve the condition of the store, where the stocks are safely kept.

In the future, Amalia dreams of expanding her current business to support the needs of her growing children and  to finance their schooling as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods and beverages and also materials for renovation of her store

loans.name: Migdonio

texts.es:
El señor Migdonio de 46 años de edad,   tiene 01 hijo que dependen  de él, vive con su esposa en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 18  años al negocio de venta maíz, leña seca, también es albañil construye casa y se dedica al cultivo de maíz por temporada que es otra fuente de ingreso para su hogar,  es un hombre trabajador con deseo de salir adelante.
Don Migdonio está solicitando el préstamo para compra de leña y semillas para cultivo con el apoyo del crédito el mejorar sus ingresos es su segundo crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño  es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Migdonio is 46 years old and has 1 son dependent upon him. He lives with his wife. He has his own home located in a community in southern Honduras. For 18 years he has had a business selling corn and dry firewood. He also is a bricklayer and builds homes. He grows corn seasonally as another source of income for his home. He is a hard-working man with the desire to be successful.

Migdonio seeks a loan to buy firewood and seeds for his crops. With the support of the loan he will improve his income. This is his second loan with Prisma. His dream is to improve his home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy firewood and seeds for his business.

loans.name: Salamatzhan

texts.ru: Саламатжан 60 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. Саламатжан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2002 году. Благодаря упорному труду Саламатжан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров и 20 овец, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 1,02 ГА картофель, кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Саламатжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Salamatzhan is 60 and married with four children. Since 2002 she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows and 20 sheep as well as 1.02 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes and corn for sale. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Salamatzhan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further developing her business and building a barn.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for fattening and subsequent resale

loans.name: Holiskhon

texts.ru: Холисхон 39 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении 5 лет она занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Холисхон, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 1,80 Га арендованной земли, где Холисхон выращивает клевер, капусту и помидоры для реализации. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она решила заняться животноводством, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств направит на ремонт автомобиля. Холисхон планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на достойную жизнь ее детей.
texts.en:
Holiskhon is 39 and married with two children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for five years. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 1.8 hectares of leased land where she grows clover, cabbage and tomatoes for sale. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month.

Holiskhon has decided to work in animal husbandry as well, and therefore has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase livestock and to repair her vehicle. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business so that she can save toward a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and repair her car in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the mother of two children, who do not attend school because they are still young. 

She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area, so she can now store up to 60,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone. 

She needs this loan to purchase charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and thus needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. 

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her two children when they attend school, so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers

loans.name: Victor Alberto

texts.es:
Victor, de 33 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas rápidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Medellín. 

Victor trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es un hombre muy responsable, juicioso y aplicado con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

El pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros, además comprara una sombrilla para su carro de comidas.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus 5 hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Victor is 33 years old. He has opted to open a fast food business near his house located in the Medellin municipality. Victor works every day from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. He is a very responsible, fair, and applied man with his business. Among his dreams are to be able to have a restaurant in which he can offer distinct types of meals and be able to offer employment. He asks for economic support for capital for his business in order to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour and other items. In addition he will buy a shade for his food cart.

The loan will impact his life and his business in a very favorable way as he will be able to fulfill his dream and have a greater variety of food to offer his customers. Additionally, it is through this business that he supports his 5 children and wife.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour and more.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира успешно погасила свой кредит, она развила свой бизнес. Индира очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, которые помогли ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день товарооборот в магазине Индиры составляет 130,000 сом (KGS), дополнительно она оказывает художественные услуги школам и детским садам. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса Индиры - 9,000 сом (KGS). Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Indira successfully paid off her previous loan and has developed her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and all investors who helped her financially. She  currently carries 130,000 KGS worth of inventory in her shop and she offers her artistic services to schools and kindergartens. Her monthly income from the business is 9,000 KGS.

Indira has turned again to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase the working capital in her shop. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale in order to increase her assortment of inventory and attract new clients

loans.name: Zhyrgal

texts.ru: Жыргал 53 года, разведена, образование высшее. Дочь замужем, живет отдельно. Попав однажды в автокатастрофу, Жыргал была в коме и потеряла голос, но несмотря ни на что она боролась за свою жизнь, стараясь доказать себе и окружающим, что она может все. Жыргал работает мед сестрой в больнице более 30 лет, получая зарплату чуть больше 10,000 сом (KGS).  Так как сейчас она живет в семейном общежитие в однокомнатной квартире, Жыргал решила построить собственный дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку окон, дверей и досок для пола. Завершив строительство дома, она сможет туда переехать.
texts.en:
Zhyrgal is 53 and divorced and has a higher education. Her duaghter is married and lives on her own. Zhyrgal was once in a coma after a car accident and lost her voice, but despite this she fought for her life, trying to prove to others and to herself that she could do anything. She has been working as a nurse in a hospital for more than 30 years, receiving a salary of a little more than 10,000 KGS. 

Since she currently lives in a one-room apartment in a family dormitory, she has decided to build her own home. Therefore she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase windows, doors and floorboards. Once she has completed her home she will be able to move there.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows and floorboards in order to finish building her house

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 38 years old. He is married, with two children, ages 1 and 3 years, not yet in school.  

He sells clothes and has been in his business for three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Treysy

texts.es:
Treysy es una persona muy Responsable y Respetuosa, tiene como objetivo llegar a culminar sus estudios Universitarios en Ingeniería Comercial, para tener un trabajo seguro y con buen ingreso. Una de sus metas es llegar a ayudar a sus padres en lo Económico y luego como toda Persona llegar a Independizarse y tener su propio hogar.
Pide este prestamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Treysy is a responsible and respectful individual. Her intention is to finish her university studies in Commercial Engineering so that she can have a stable job and a good income. One of her goals is to help her parents financially and eventually become someone who is independent and has a home of her own.

Treysy is requesting this loan so that she can cover her university fees. This will allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Mathias, Bilkisu and Abba.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Dauda spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Xalig

texts.en:
Xalig is 37 years old, and he lives with his mother in Fuzuli region. For 22 years, he has been an I.D.P. (or  Internally Displaced Person) from Füzuli city. When Xalig was 14 years his father died in war and he had to work to help his family. 

He has been in his business for seven years. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar. 

Today Xalig needs AZN 1,300.  For this reason he has applied to Kiva's partner Komak for a loan. He wants to buy enough hay to get his cows through the winter.


He thanks Kiva and Komak for help. In future he wants to build a stall and get married.

loans.use: to buy enough hay to get his cows through the winter

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en:
Ibrahim A. is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim A. would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim A. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim A. is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family,  He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby reducing pressure to sell his corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Mathew is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby reducing pressure to sell his corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has a mobile money transfer business, and it has been profitable. He is 30 years of age and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with two children. 

He also does farming in Oloitoktok town, where he has been in the farming business for two years. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting in his farm. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya.  His future hopes are to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Esther, 54, are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food. Esther is a rural farmer in Nkubu, Kenya, which is an area known for having hardworking men and women.

Esther is blessed with four children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. On her farm she grows maize, and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize, and when she is not farming Esther does some side business to meet her expenses and provide the best for her family. Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Esther said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge however, is a shortage of water.

She is kindly requesting a loan to buy a generator that she will use to pump water from the river to her farm. Through this loan she will have continuous production on her farm, which will translate to an increase in production levels. This will result in increased income levels and hence improved living standards. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina  owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She is a forty-two-year-old married woman living in Mcarthur, Leyte.  She sells basic commodities like biscuits, candies, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages. She has been operating a store for two years now. She and her husband have six children. Three of them are still attending school.

Divina is asking for a loan in the amount of 35,000 PHP to buy additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, toiletries and seasonings. With these, she can now continue to operate her business, fill her store again with merchandise,  and eventually it will augment higher income.

In addition to this, Divina hopes she could manage her business well in order to finance the schooling of her children and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Tigwirizane Group

texts.en:
Judith is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling eggs, chips and tomatoes in the nearby market. She has three children and has been operating her business for the past four years. She is a hard worker and is requesting this loan to bulk buy things in order to attract more customers and increase her profit margin. 

With the previous profits, she has been able to satisfy her family's basic needs, and she is able to send her children to private schools. Judith believes that the knowledge she gained in business management from MLF's training will help her to have a sustainable business. Her ambition is to diversify her business with a grocery shop when she has enough money. As a woman, she hopes to accumulate funds to start building a good house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes, eggs and tomatoes

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 24-years old and a garment worker who works in a city. He is from the Takeo province of Cambodia. He has worked as a garment worker since 2011, earning $5 a day. 

Channy is also pursuing a sewing-machine-repair course. Due to the fact that he is short of finances to pay his course fee, he decided to take a loan. This loan will help him go through the course successfully. After earning the skill, he wants to find a better job and then save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay his course fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides and seeds for planting on his farm.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 35 years old. She is married with five children between 6 and 15 years old, all of whom go to school.  She sells clothes and has been doing this business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 46 years old. She is married, with six children aged between 6 and 22 years; all of them go to school.  She sells clothes and has been running a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more skirts and shirts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more skirts anad shirts to resell.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en:
Dhahabu is a married woman with four children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dhahabu has been operating a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer emprendedora de 50 años de edad, madre de una hija de 8 años y es una madre soltera 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hija, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual ya posee una maquina de confección en su casa; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Alba is an entrepreneurial woman of 50, the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She is a single mother.

During her productive life, she has worked in various sewing workshops as a machine operator. For this reason, she possesses experience and knowledge in managing this type of business. But, tired of working in other workshops and with the spirit to spend more time with her daughter, she decided to set up her own sewing workshop, for which she already has a sewing machine in her house. For this reason, she was encouraged to apply for the loan, which will be invested in the purchase of a serger, an overlock machine, and dressmaking supplies such as fabric and thread.

This will allow her to put her productive project into operation, and with it she hopes to generate an impact in the sector, so that it generates a favorable profitability for her, and thus she can accomplish her dream of positioning herself in the market.

With her drive and ambition, she sees herself generating employment in the medium-term future, always with the help of Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy a serger, an overlock machine, and dressmaking supplies such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Estrella De David Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Estrella de David está conformada por seis mujeres y dos hombres, madres responsables  con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios  Telica, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tienen por actividades económicas diferentes, la coordinadora es Ángela y tiene por actividad una pulularía es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche pan, huevos et. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación,  ella dedica a su actividad económica unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería, la asociación comunal Estrella de David agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrella de David (Star of David) is formed by six women and two men. They are responsible parents with fifteen children in their care. They are natives of Telica, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized as being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. Unfortunately, they were not able to get an education due to lack of economic resources.

Thanks to their will to advance, they have various economic activities. The coordinator is Angela, and her business is a little grocery store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, etc. She has the business located in her home. She works in her business some twelve hours a day, offering her products, so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store. 

The communal association Estrella de David is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, and eggs for her store.

loans.name: Jhon Edisson

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Jhon es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.

El prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos el podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Jhon's perseverance and courage, he can make a decent living. He prepares and sells fast food in the municipality of Medellín. He started this activity with the desire to find new income to support his family. His wife and children are his main motivation to work daily and to strive to be better every day.

Jhon wants to give a boost to his business by purchasing ingredients and raw materials. This boost can be given by 'Interactuar Corporation' and Kiva lenders. With these items, he can have his dishes available for his clients at all times. His dream is to have a restaurant in the same area so as to not lose his clients.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw materials to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Evangeline is a married woman with four children, residing in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 10. She engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food like siakoy (a twisted fried donut that is dipped in white sugar). She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now. Her husband is a welder. 

Evangeline has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional supplies like  bread flour, yeast, sugar, milk and salt. These supplies will help Evangeline produce and sell more siakoy (twisted fried donut). In the long run, she  could provide her children with good food and better living conditions.

In the future, Evangeline is hoping that she could manage her current business well, as this could help improve her living status.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like  bread flour, yeast, sugar, milk and salt

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been a farmer for the past seven years, and from the sale of the farm produce, she has been able to provide for her family’s needs.  She is 57-years old and a single mother of four children. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her house and also renovate it. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 36 years old and a single mother of two children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income and be able to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Neiser Edwin

texts.es: Neiser tiene 38 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales . Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar frejol y obtener una producción buena y comprar unos cerdos para criarles. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en: Neser is 38 years old. He works in agriculture and raising animals. He lives in San Miguel, in the province of Bolivar, in the community of Pucara. He is applying for the loan to purchase organic compost and fertilizers to begin planting beans and obtain a good production and buy some pigs to raise. He makes his purchases in San Pablo every two weeks because there is not frequent transportation. His dream is to get ahead with his family. He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: Victor de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una sala de belleza y barbería ubicada cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, posee muchos clientes por la calidad de trabajo que realiza, su esposa tambien le ayuda en el negocio, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, maquina para cortar barba entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Victor, 38, lives in his own house with his wife. He owns a beauty salon and barbershop located near his home in a busy area. He has a lot of clients because of the quality of work he does. His wife also helps him run the business. Victor is requesting a loan to buy lotions, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and a beard trimmer, among other things that he needs so that he can generate higher revenue which will help him have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy  lotions, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and a beard trimmer, among other things.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 49 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 15 years; three of them go to school.  She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more small fish to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more small fish to resell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, who is 41 years old, is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children. She is a cash crop farmer in Emali Town and has been in this business for 15 years. 

Teresa has requested for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and she will be using it to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business, to be able to provide for the basic needs of her family and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  María Lourdes  de 30  años de edad,  tiene 01 hijo que dependen de ella y su esposo, tiene casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de tortillas.
Doña María Lourdes tiene su negocio en su casa y hasta ahí llegan los clientes a comprarle,  también su esposo vende verduras y le apoya económicamente es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María Lourdes está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal. con el apoyo del crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos  y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
30-year-old María Lourdes has one child who depends on her and her husband. She has her own house, which is located in a community in San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. She has made a living for the past three years by selling tortillas.

María Lourdes runs her business from her house; her clients come to buy from her. Her husband sells vegetables and financially supports her. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead in life.

María Lourdes is requesting the loan in order to buy maize, firewood, and lime. With the help of the loan, she aims to improve her earnings and her quality of life.

Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, and lime for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 59 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with nine children. He does farming in Machakos Town where he keeps livestock and also does horticulture. 

John has been in this business for the past ten years and it has been profitable. He plans to use this loan to buy cows and goats for rearing. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is John's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
El Señor José Humberto   de 37 años de edad está casado, vive con esposa y sus hijos   que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y  se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace 8 años al negocio de venta de jarrones de barro, maseteras, mariquitas, cuadros de pinturas, etc. sus clientes le prefieren por su buen surtido y su buena amabilidad, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras.
Don José Humberto  es hombre  emprendedor dedicado  a su familia y su negocio esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pintura, pinceles, barro, etc. para  seguir elaborando su producto con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir un poco su negocio.
Su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen y mantener más  amplio su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
37-year-old José Humberto is married. He lives with his wife and children, who depend on him. He has his own house and has owned his own business for eight years. He sells clay vases, gardening pots, ladybugs, paintings, and other things. His clients prefer his business due to his good stock and his friendliness. He lives in a community in San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. 

José Humberto is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his family and his business. He is requesting the loan in order to buy paint, brushes, clay, and other materials so he can continue making his products. With the help of this loan, he aims to improve his earnings and restock his business a little.
His dream is to have his children graduate and to expand his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes, clay, and other items for his business

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with six children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest expenses are food and clothing.

For over three years now, she has operated a small shop selling makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing) to the community. She faces competition as a major challenge. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of goods for resale. Dama decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods for resale

loans.name: Suwaiba

texts.en:
Suwaiba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Suwaiba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Musa, Balaraba and Aisha.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Suwaiba would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Suwaiba can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Suwaiba  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Beli Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en: The self-help group named Beli Mahila Samuha is being led by Karmi (the lady who is standing with her hand raised). It is comprised of distinctive and hardworking women who hail from Banddih, a small village in the Dumka district of Jharkhand. These members, who run various small businesses, have collectively approached MESP (Micrograam’s field partner) for a loan. Karmi’s husband is a blacksmith. He has been doing this business for a long time. Karmi has a son and two daughters. Her son works with her husband and both the daughters are studying.The family income is not sufficient to meet the expenses, so Karmi planned to take a loan from Kiva to invest in her husband’s business, which will help her to increase her family's monthly income. The rest of the members of the group need the loan to improve their livelihoods. All of these members have been running their own businesses for a long time now. The loan that they have asked for will help them in increasing their family incomes and in planning a better future for their children. This will help them save their income and gear themselves up in case of emergencies. This loan surely will change their lives.

loans.use: to invest in a blacksmith business

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es:
La asociación  comunal El Tule Sur está conformada por ocho mujeres solteras  responsables de veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. La coordinadora es  Nidia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos en un lugar específico de unos de los mercados de su localidad. Su negocio consiste en vender granos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, trigo, cereales, jabón, detergente, et.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de granos básicos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Tule Sur agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas d escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
The communal bank El Tule Sur is made up of eight single women, responsible for twenty children who are under their care. They are originally from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the region. They are characterized by being hard workers, responsible, and eager for personal growth. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, they were not able to go to school, and they needed to work at an early age to help with household expenses.
They are currently struggling day to day to bring better opportunities to their children. The coordinator is Nidia, and her occupation is the sale of staple goods in a specific location in one of the markets nearby. Her business consists of selling goods, such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, wheat, cereals, soap, detergent, etc. She spends twelve hours a day in her business, offering her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to supply her business with staple goods, so that in the not-so-distant future she can obtain a better income. Tule Sur is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders bring to people of scarce resources in poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to be able to have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic staple goods, such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Arecely de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas desde hace 6 años, con las ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento,arena, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su familia puedan vivir comodos.
texts.en: 43-year-old Arecely lives in her own house with her family. She has made a living for the past six years by selling cakes. She manages to get ahead in life with the profits from her sales. She wants to improve her home by building a room in the place shown in the photograph, but it is not within her means to achieve this; for this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay workers and to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and metal sheets so that she and her family can live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay workers and to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and metal sheets

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 57-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cefeno, her business partner, and has five children. Three of the children  are still in high school and two are already working. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily personal and household needs, and for her children's education.

Edna has operated a computer rental shop for three years. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go to an internet café  for their business documents and school requirements. She rents out computers by the hour, and offers printing and typing services. She also has rooms for rent and a burger vending. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a new PC, and for the maintenance of her computers at her shop. Her income from her internet shop is a big help to meet the family’s basic needs.

Edna aims to grow her business and send her children to school until college. She prays for a happy and harmonious family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it's also where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her computers and to purchase another computer.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 31 years old. She is married with three children between 2 and 14 years old and two of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fish to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested and used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique is 24 years old. He is not married.

Pacifique sells clothes and has been in business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Meisho

texts.en:
Meisho is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but has no piped water.

Meisho has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors requiring for repayment for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, Meisho is requesting 15,000 KES; she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Pisal

texts.en:
Pisal is a 21-year-old garment worker who is from the Takeo province of Cambodia.  He has worked as a worker in a city since 2010, earning $6 per day.  Pisal is also taking a sewing-machine repair course. Because of a lack of finances to pay his course fees, he requested a loan.  This loan will help him finish the course successfully. 

In the future, he is going to run a small sewing-machine repair shop so he will be able to save money to build and own a home.

loans.use: to pay his course fees.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

Luvuno wants to start an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of how to get customers into her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 Luvuno wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and has no children.  She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Elizabeth operates a grocery vegetables sales stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors.  She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 15,000 KES loan she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.  She operates a business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Eva is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through the last 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mu'azu

texts.en: Mu'azu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mu'azu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sani, Madina and Falalu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mu'azu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mu'azu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mu'azu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Talia Group

texts.en:
Liliane is the featured borrower of Talia group. She is applying for a loan with the other group members from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Liliane is an 18-year-old single lady who has worked for a year as a hairdresser in a beauty salon to cover her needs and expenses. She is a talented lady who has a good reputation, as she is known among her region for her proficiency in the beauty field. She is an ambitious girl who is trying hard to develop her own business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to achieve her dream by opening her own beauty salon. This loan is very important to Liliane for it will help her make the first step toward a successful future.

With respect to the other group members, Nawa is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who works in handicrafts and wants to renovate her house. Sarah is a 27-year-old single lady who works as a manicurist and wants to develop her business with new nail polish colors, and Zeina is a 19-year-old single lady who tutors and wants to pay her university tuition fees.

Liliane is the second lady on the right, Nawa is the first lady on the left, Sarah is the second lady on the left, and Zeina is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hajara joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Usaini, Hassana and Asama'U.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hajara spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia, who is a 59-year-old married woman, lives in small village called Bandza. She has a pensioner husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Mzia's son works at the local state structure and earns a fixed salary. For her family's well-being Mzia engaged in cattle breeding, and in cultivating family-owned agricultural land, where she harvests nuts. She sells milk products and nuts locally and has her own loyal costumers. 

To increase productivity and her monthly income, Mzia decided to build a greenhouse where she will plant various kinds of vegetables and greens and will sell them for good prices at the local market. Now she needs financial support to realize her desire and to purchase all needed merchandise and tools to build the greenhouse. 

Mzia is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family with a good style of life. This credit will be a great support for them. Mzia and her family members rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en: Anathalie is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 5 and 18 years, and all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for her children, Ruben and Emmanuel.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time. She will be able to sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children. She hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs, eventually.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 64, and a resident of GMA, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Glicerio, who is her business partner. She has six children of which one is in college, three are already working and two are out of school. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income to meet their daily personal and household needs and for their child’s education.

Adora operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go to an Internet Café for their business, school requirements and business documents. Adora rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy computer accessories such as a printer, mouse and keypad and also to pay for the maintenance of her computers. It is important that all her computers are all working efficiently to ensure good service to her customers. Her income from her Internet Shop is a big help to support family’s basic needs.

Adora aims to buy more personal computers to grow her business. She wants her child to finish college and save for her old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of her computers as well.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina has been married for over 27 years and has two children. Now she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in the Fuzuli region. She is a very good grandmother and her grandchildren love her very much. For 22 years already, the family members have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Madina rents a shop in the local bazaar where she sells food products. Today, Madina is planning to increase her business. She needs 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more products (butter, sugar, tea, candy and etc.) to sell. Madina gives great thanks to the Kiva organization for a loan and help.

loans.use: to buy products, increase business, and in the future, make repairs in her store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon es un hombre 52 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo varon de 25 años y una hija mujer de 17 años, y su negocio es el servicio técnico a máquinas de imprenta. 
El es independiente, trabajador, constante y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Calama’ un área caracterizada por reunir a las empresas que realizan impresiones de todo tipo, como; banner, gigantografias, carteles, letreros, etc. de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que promedia los 15 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Simon es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español para el comercio. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a labores de casa y su hija menor que estudia en la escuela, su hijo mayor ya es independiente. La familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su trabajo es el Servicio de mantenimiento y  reparación de maquinaria de imprenta como; guillotinas manuales, eléctricas y con sistema Hidráulico, troqueladoras, maquinas hot stamping, perforadoras, máquinas de sellos, máquinas serigrafías, cambio de rodillos. Su experiencia en el rubro le ayuda a arreglar máquinas de las marcas; ryobi, heidelberg, akiyama, etc. “empecé mi trabajo desde muy joven como ayudante de un taller de maquinaria, hace 12 años me independicé y ahora trabajo solo” comenta. su sueño es tener un taller de imprenta, y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina cepilladora, para tener otro rubro donde trabajar. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que trabaja independientemente en este rubro.
Es por esos motivos que Simon solicita un préstamo para la compra de un máquina cepilladora de pisos para tener otro rubro donde trabajar.
texts.en:
Simon, 52, is married and has a son, 25, and a daughter, 17.  His business is servicing printing machines.  He's an independent, hardworking, tenacious, and responsible man.

He works in the Calama area, known for the concentration of businesses that offer all types of printing, including banners, billboards, posters, and signs.  The climate is cold and dry, with an average temperature of 15 degrees centigrade all year long.

Simon is short and dark and has short dark hair.  His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for business.  He lives with his wife, a homemaker, and his younger daughter, a student.  His older son is already on his own.  The family lives in their own home, a brick house with potable water and electricity.
