His job is maintaining and repairing printing machinery such as manual, electric, and hydraulic paper cutters; punch presses; hot stamping machines; perforators; stamping machines; silkscreen machines; and changing cylinders.  His experience in the field helps him fix different brands of machine: Ryobi, Heidelberg, Akiyama, etc.  "I started my job at a very young age as a helper in a machine shop.  I went out on my own 12 years ago and now I work alone," he said.

His dream is to have a print shop, and he wants to expand his business with the purchase of a floor planing machine so he has another line of work.

This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 12 years he has worked independently in this field.

loans.use: to buy a floor planing machine so he has another line of work

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is grateful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy personal merchandise products of the popular direct-selling brands. With her earnings, she has been able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

Now, she would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use this new loan to buy a greater stock of clothing, footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. These purchases would prepare her to meet the increased orders of her customers, for Christmas gift-giving. Her business is a stable income source, to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Jenalyn dreams of having her own store in which to display her products and expand her business. She aims to give her children the best education, in order for them to have a bright future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.


*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a stock of products like clothing, footwear, underwear, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ishaya joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for her children: Mathew, Jamima, and Gambo. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store her maize at harvest time. She can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ishaya  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs, eventually.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kwa Mbonde Group

texts.en:
Said is in his early 60s, married, and has two children who are still at school. He has been running a genge business for three years. He works from 2:00AM to midnight daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Said's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in his genge. He dreams of growing his genge until it is big.

Said will share this loan with his borrowing group, Kwa Mbonde, which is comprised of five members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in his genge.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a grocery business, and she is also a livestock farmer, in Emali town. She has been in this business for 20 years, and it has been profitable. She is 55 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children.

She will use this loan to buy a stock of onions to sell and livestock to raise, which she will later sell at a profit. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standard of her family.

This is Mary's sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to have a prosperous business and live a happy life with her family

loans.use: to buy a stock of onions to sell and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 56 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos de 23, 19, 17 y 15 años y su trabajo es la pesca.
El es independiente, constante, responsable, paciente y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad “Hauacaña Huatajata” que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como; la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Andres es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymará que se habla en el lugar para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos; todos realizan labores de agricultura y los dos hijos menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; La pesca del lago Titicaca es uno de los artes de pesca más bonitos, artesanos, y respetuosos con el lago y los fondos marinos que existen, ya que este arte de pesca consiste en arrojar al lago una línea de red, que suele ser desde 30 metros de largo. Al dejar caer la red en el fondo, y dejarla allí un día a modo de trampa, y luego simplemente recogerla, hace que no arrastre y destruya los fondos marinos, y solo queden atrapadas piezas del tamaño que se busca según grosor de red, y pescar solo las variedades que se quieren, “la pesca en el lago es sumamente tranquila, el frío del lugar congela todo a su alrededor, debemos tener bastante paciencia en el trabajo diario…” comenta.  Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de redes de pesca por mayor, debido a que estas se rompen continuamente y todo el tiempo debe renovarlas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Andrés solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para tener material de trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Andrés is a man of 56. He is married and has four children, ages, 23, 19, 17, and 15. His work is fishing.

He is independent, persistent, responsible, patient, and hard-working. He does his work in the "Hauacaña Huatajata" community, which is located near Lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where cattle and sheep are raised. People live from fishing and also from vegetables of the area, such as quinoa, dried potatoes, beans, potatoes, etc. The area is characterized by its cold climate, where the rays of the sun strike the surface strongly, at an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level.

Andres has a dark complexion, short stature, and short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is spoken in the area. For business in the city, he speaks Spanish. He lives with his children. All do agricultural work, and the two youngest are in school. They live in their own house made of adobe, which has potable water and electricity. His business is fishing by boat with a net. Fishing in Lake Titicaca is one of the fishing arts that is the most beautiful, artisanal, and respectful of the lake and the marine depths that exist, since the art of fishing consists of throwing a line of net that is usually about 30 meters long into the lake. After letting the net fall to the bottom and leaving it there for a day as a trap and then simply collecting it, he makes sure that it doesn't drag and destroy the lake bottom. Only fish of the size that are sought remain trapped, according to the thickness of the net, and he fishes only for the varieties that are wanted. "Fishing in the lake is exceedingly peaceful. The cold of the place freezes everything around it. We have to have quite a lot of patience in the daily work," he comments. His dream is to improve the quality of life of his family, and he wants to expand his business through the purchase of fishing nets wholesale, since they break continually and he always has to repair them. This is his first loan with the institution in the 20 years that he has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Andrés is applying for a loan to purchase fishing nets wholesale in order to have a steady supply of work materials.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets wholesale in order to have a steady supply of work materials

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean that people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Jane, a 35-year-old mixed farmer based in Kipsaiya, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. 

Jane believes that farming is learned through experience, and little by little, she has been perfecting her techniques and abilities in this field. She is a mother of four school-going children whom she truly loves and greatly adores. Jane always describes her upbringing as challenging, and that is why she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her children and to be able to secure their future. 

Jane has been farming for over 10 years. Over the years, she has gained much experience and is now considered one of the best farmers in her village because of the immense knowledge that she possesses. Jane passionately loves dairy farming and she has even nicknamed one of her cows. Since she has excess dairy food and enough space on her land, Jane has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but the challenge that she has been facing is lack of finances. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Jane to turn their dreams into reality. 

Jane believes that the loan will help her to satisfy the milk demand in her area and, through the accumulated profits, she will be able to realize her dream of developing her business into a large enterprise. Many women in Kenya are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family. Jane, being a hardworking farmer, wants to provide all of the basic needs that her children and parents require. Jane is much disciplined with her finances and she knows that with the accumulated profits, she will be able to fully repay her loan.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Majeed

texts.en: Majeed is a 39-year-old married man living in Jarash. Majeed started working as a barber 15 years ago, which helped him gain the experience and make new client connections. This has allowed him recently to open his own barbershop with a section that sells barber tools and shaving tools. He is taking this loan to help him buy more goods for the shop and renew its decoration to make more space to include one more barber chair. His future plan is to be a supplier and a distributer to all barbershops in the area.

loans.use: to buy new shaving tools to sell and renew the shop decoration to make more space to include one more barber chair

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 62 years old, and a single mother of two children. She has been selling cereals for five years, and it has been a profitable business.

She plans to use this loan to buy a stock of maize and beans to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business, by again buying more cereals to sell.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans, successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with five children. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for 15 years. He rears cattle, sheep and poultry. 

He plans to use this loan to buy lambs and rear them. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farming business. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he successfully repaid his previous loans. His future hopes are to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Dairy farming is more of a passion than a business, for Catherine. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2008. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Kipsaiya, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of two, lovely children. For the past six years she has been making a small living by practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income.

Catherine passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing capital to grow her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan, and she used it to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back, fully. She also benefited from training, and the impact of the first loan must not be underestimated.

Now Catherine is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, and Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The animal she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow capable of producing between 15 and 20 liters of milk, per day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means the cow will be making 11 USD worth of milk, per day. From this loan, the life of Catherine will permanently change, and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Catherine waits for your kindness. Her farm will be maintained and go from strength to strength, with your help!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 42 years old. She is married with six children between 5 and 24 years old, all of whom go to school.  She sells milk and has been doing this business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Aisha joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Friday and Saratu.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Aisha would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aisha can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Aisha spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en: Jibrin is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jibrin would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jibrin can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked about his goals, Jibrin expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Garba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Garzali, Kamalu and Karima. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Garba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Kelita belongs to Tipindule credit group, and she is 34 years old with two children and three dependents who go to school. 

She is a welder selling door frames, windows and gates, together with her husband Patrick. She is doing this business in order to improve her family's living standards and to be able to pay school fees for her children. Before she started welding, she was operating a hardware shop and had been doing so during previous years. 

Kelita is a hard worker who works like a man, and she wants this loan to purchase raw materials in large quantities, like metals to produce more things such as windows and gates in order to satisfy the customer needs and maximize her profits. With the previous profits made, she has managed to build a house for her family, and she also hopes to buy a secondhand vehicle for her family when she makes enough profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as metals

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school.She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dama has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal sellers, in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy facial treatments and new barber chairs.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. La'azarus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zion and Ketra. Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, La'azarus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer from Kiyawa in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Maryamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en: Zainab and Basam are married and live in AlBaqaa. Basam has a cart where he sells homs lupine beans and corn. He has another five carts that are for rent and he works two shifts in the day: morning and evening shifts. They want to improve their life by buying a house rather than renting one. They are applying for a loan for equipment and raw materials for the cart.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of raw materials for his cart

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: It is common to have a sheep farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Viola is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kapsowar, a remote village in Kenya. She is a mother of two lovely children and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. To earn a decent living, she sells eggs, milk, and greens and engages in numerous small personal businesses, including transportation. Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through sheep farming. In the past, she saw raising sheep as just a hobby. She wants to sell sheep meat and wool but assumes that the quantity she produces will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more sheep. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business. Viola is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a quality breed of sheep. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her sheep farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy a good quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a man living in Jarash. He is studying for a bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering, and is now in his second year. Mohammad's future plan is to work in the same field.

Income for his family of four comes from his father's job. Lack of income and some potential financial problems that they have lead Mohammed to apply for an educational loan to help cover his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Saulawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Enshirah

texts.en: Enshirah is a 50-year-old married woman living in a sector called AlWihdat in Amman. She has a mini-market that she started six years ago in her house and she expanded it to her home garage where she sells foodstuff. She also sells at her home girls' clothing items on special occasions. Enshirah opens the mini market at 8 in the morning and closes at 7 in the evenings. She is looking to hire someone that can help her at the shop so she can look after her family more but that will need more money than she can afford now. Enshirah is applying for this loan to add more variety of food products and more detergents that will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to add more variety of food products and more detergents that will help her increase her income.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 23-year-old lady living in Mafraq. She is studying for a Bachelor's degree in languages and she is now in her third year. The family's income comes out of retirement and job income and her father for her family of seven members. The challenge faced by Alaa and her family is the rising living costs. Alaa applied for an educational loan to help cover her semester fee. Alaa's future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: To pay her semester fees

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en:
Tsisana is a 48-year-old woman from Batumi city, west Georgia. She lives with her son and she alone takes care of her little family. Tsisana and her son didn't have any source of income and were living in poverty until she opened a grocery store and started her own business. She found a place in a good location of town involved in trading business. 

Because of her poor living conditions and lack of financial opportunities, Tsisana requested support from local financial institutions. Her loan application was rejected several times because of the family's poor living conditions. Tsisana requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who are regarded as "high-risk borrowers" because of their low income and do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Tsisana will purchase additional food supplies and will have money for working capital. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will be the the family's only source of income. Tsisana and her son will be really grateful and will highly appreciate the help that Kiva lenders can provide.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en: Mamuda is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mamuda would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mamuda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Mamuda is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 26 years old and lives with his parents, wife and one little daughter in his father's home. They live in the Füzuli region, and for 22 years they have been IDP (internally displcated persons) from Füzuli city.

Samir is engaged in sheep-breeding at their homestead yard. He and his wife, together with his mother, prepare dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.) which he sells in the local bazaar to earn money. Also he periodically sells sheep's wool. 

Today Samir needs 1,350 AZN, and for this reason he has applied to Kiva's partner, Komak, for a loan. He is planning his supplies for the winter and wants to buy enough hay for his sheep. In the future, he wants to buy a new house and live there with his lovely family.

He is thankful to Kiva and Komak for their help.

loans.use: to buy enough hay for his sheep and to increase business, as in future he wants to buy a new house and live there with his lovely family.

loans.name: Willy Ange

texts.en:
Willy Ange is 35 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 13 years old, and 2 of them go to school.  

Willy Ange sells clothes, and he has been doing this as a business for 2 years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

With the loan of 10,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Umaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hassan, Hamisu and Mubarak.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Umaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Umaru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Umaru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Blanca Vilma

texts.es: Blanca de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella vive con su esposo en casa propia y esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, harina de arroz y demás ingredientes para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Blanca, 53, has been making pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for 15 years.  She works from home where she lives with her husband.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, pork cracklings, cheese, rice flour and other ingredients to continue her work.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, pork cracklings, cheese, rice flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIVINO NIÑO EL SAUCE ESTA CONFORMADA POR SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON  DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL  SAUCE  SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS  NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDA CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. 
EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLE UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS  HIJOS, LA COORDINADORA ES  LUISA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE COSMÉTICOS DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN COSMÉTICOS COMO: LABIALES, RUBOR, SOMBRA DE OJOS, LÁPIZ DE OJOS, DELINEADOR, MARBELLINE, CREMA ANTI OJERAS, PERFUMES ETC.. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO. LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIVINO NIÑO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES  POBRE COMO ES  NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Nino el Sauce is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers with 10 children under their care. They are originally from Sauce and are characterized by being responsible and hard-working, with the desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, they were not able to study and they saw themselves as obligated to work from a young age to help cover household expenses.  They struggle daily to give their children a better future.

The coordinator, Luisa, works as a street vendor and also at home selling cosmetics such as lipstick, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, eye cream, perfumes, etc.  She works eight hours a day selling her merchandise.  The purpose of her loan is to stock her business.

The communal bank Divino Nino del Sauce is grateful to Kive lenders for the help they give people with low incomes in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as lipstick, blush, eye shasdow, eyeliner, eye cream, perfumes.

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Khardiatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle loge dans les environs du guichet. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Khardiatou vient pour la première fois solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour renforcer son activité de vente de produits divers. Elle est active de 9h à 17h. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra acheter des chaussures, des sacs, des tissus qu’elle vendra à sa clientèle des bureaux. Avec les bénéfices générés, elle peut s’occuper de ses propres besoins et appuyer sa famille. 
Khardiatou souhaite ouvrir un magasin de vente de produits cosmétiques dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou is married and has children.  She lives locally to the field partner's office and has been working as a trader for more than 15 years.

This will be the first loan for Khadidiatou, with the field partner, UIMCEC, and she plans to use it to improve her sales business.  Her working day runs from nine in the morning until five in the evening.  She plans to use her loan to buy shoes, bags and fabric which she will sell to her customers, most of whom work in offices.

Khadidiatou's profits will be used to provide for her own needs and those of her family.

In the future, Khadidiatou would like to open a shop selling cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags and assorted fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Musa G.

texts.en:
Musa G. is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa G. would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa G. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Musa G., like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To cover immediate cash needs such as food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Alice operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Commerçante de poissons depuis 2011, AMI est une jeune dame âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants ;elle s’approvisionne à la frontière Togo-Ghana trois fois par mois et passe au moins trois heures du temps pour frire les poissons, puis vend dans les environs du quartier Ségbé où elle habite.AMI désire un crédit ,vue l’affluence de ses clients qui ne cessent de croître ;ce qui lui permettra d’aider son marie dans les dépenses du foyer et aussi mieux épargner pour d’éventuels besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ami has been selling fish since 2011.  She is 36 years old, married and has four children.  She buys her supplies from the border between Togo and Ghana, three times a month.  She then spends at least three hours frying the fish, before selling it around the Ségbé district where she lives.

Ami has requested this loan as her customer base is continually expanding as is the demand for her fish.  This loan will enable her to help her husband meet the costs of their household, and also increase their savings level.

loans.use: to buy 8 baskets of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ngane

texts.fr:
La dame Ngane, s’active dans la vente de fruits depuis des années. Elle tient une étale sur la route nationale. Ngane a démarré avec un capital minime, qui lui a permis d’acheter quelques kilogrammes d’orange, de mandarine, de banane qu’elle vendait. Au fur et à mesure de voir son capitale augmenté, elle s’est trouvé un endroit sur la route pour mieux vendre sa marchandise. Ngane est mariée et mère de famille ; elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et s’occupe de ses besoins personnels.
Elle rêve de pouvoir augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de varier sa marchandise pour être plus attrayante.
texts.en:
Ngane has been selling fruit for many years, from a stall on the main road.  She began her business with minimal capital, with which she bought several kilogrammes of oranges, mandarines and bananas.  Little by little she built up her capital and moved to a better position on the road.

Ngane is married and has children.  She contributes to the costs of her family and is responsible for her own needs.

Ngane dreams of increasing her working capital so she could offer a more attractive range of goods.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale (bananas, mandarines and oranges).

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: YAWA est une femme âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants ; elle habite le quartier Adidogomé et fait la restauration de la pâte fermentée généralement appelée "kome" emballé par la balle de maïs, au marché « Assiyéyé » depuis 2013, mais par manque de moyen, elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Noépé située au porte de la ville de Lomé. YAWA désire un microcrédit pour soutenir son activité génératrice de revenue, mieux épargner et participer activement aux charges de son foyer.
texts.en:
Yawa is 61 years old, married and mother to three children.  She lives in the Adidogomé district and has been running a restaurant business since 2013.  She makes and sells 'kome', which is a fermented paste wrapped in a ball of maize, at the Assiyéyé market.  

Unfortunately, due to lack of funds, Yawa must buy her supplies three times a month from the Noépé market which is situated on the outskirts of Lomé.

Yawa has requested this micro-loan to build up her business, provide more savings and allow her to actively contribute to the expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of maize for use in her food business.

loans.name: Kinbinkadi Group

texts.fr: Client de ACFIME  depuis novembre 2010, le groupe kinkinkadi regroupe 10 femmes battantes qui exercent dans le domaine de la restauration et le commerce de détail. Ce groupe est à son 12ème prêt avec l’institution et jusque là, il n'ya pas eu de problème de remboursement. Antine, membre représentatif est veuve et a deux enfants qui sont tous mariés. Elle fait la restauration comme activité. Antine a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter de la boisson, du riz, de l'huile et les autres ingrédients nécessaires pour son restaurant.Cette brave dame propose des plats diversifiés à ses clients. Selon notre politique, d'ici la fin de ce prêt, elle aura épargné 35 000 francs CFA, en plus de cette épargne, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra d’accroître son restaurant et faire face à ses propres dépenses.
texts.en:
The 'Kinbinkadi' Group has been a client of the field partner, ACFIME, since November 2010.  There are ten, strong women members of the group, who work in restaurants and retail.

This will be the twelfth loan for the women.  All the previous loans have been fully and correctly repaid.

Antine is the group representative.  She is a widow and has two children who are both married.  She runs a restaurant business and will use her loan to buy drinks, rice, oil, and other necessary ingredients.  This impressive woman offers many different dishes to her customers.

In keeping with our regulations, by the end of the loan cycle, Antine will have saved 35,000 francs CFA.  In addition to this, she will have made a profit which will allow her to expand her business and provide for her own expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Alcibar Miguel

texts.es: Alcivar tiene 40 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura ya que no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que solventar a su familia que consta de sus dos hijos y su mujer. Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar frejol y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad a la que se dedica. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos para que lleguen hacer profesionales, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en: Alcivar is 40 years old and is a farmer. He does not have a stable job and has to cover family expenses; Alcivar is married and has two children. Alcivar lives in San Miguel in Bolívar province, in the Pucara community. He is applying for this loan in order to buy manure and fertilisers to begin to sow beans and have a good yield. This is Alcivar's only source of income. Alcivar buys his supplies in San Pablo every fortnight as there is no regular public transport. Alcivar's dream is to help his children to get ahead so that they may each have a profession. In his spare time, Alcivar likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers.

loans.name: Fidias Jesus

texts.es: Fidias de 50 años de edad posee un negocio de compra y venta de chatarra (hierro, cobre, bronce, aluminio, etc.) su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 23 años, el vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Fidias is 50 years old and has a business buying and selling scrap metal (iron, copper, bronze, aluminium and others). He has run his business out of his home for 23 years. Fidias owns the house where he lives with his wife and four children. He is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise in bulk and continue with his business. This is Fidias' only source of income.

loans.use: to buy iron, copper, bronze, aluminium and other metals.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario de 45 años de edad es madre soltera, y es por ello que cada día se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de: bebidas frías, golosinas, galletas, etc. actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad y una hija de 23 años de edad. Rosario sabe que su única fuente de ingresos es su negocio y que de él también depende la economía de su hogar, es por ello que desea surtir su negocio adquiriendo un crédito con FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: pan dulce, café, azúcar, huevos, leche, arroz, frijoles, etc. Para surtir su negocio y así obtener más y mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old and a single mother. For this reason she works hard every day to support her household. She makes a living selling cold drinks, snacks, biscuits, etc. She has had her business for 3 years, and it is located in a place where there are always lots of people coming and going. 

Rosario lives in her own home together with her little 10 year old son and her 23 year old daughter. She knows that her business is the only source of income for herself and her household, and so she wants to stock her shop using a loan from FUSAI, which will allow her to buy pastries, bread, biscuits, coffee, sugar, eggs, milk, rice, beans, etc.. Stocking her shop in this way will allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pastries, bread, biscuits, coffee, sugar, eggs, milk, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa, de 20 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Desea iniciar un negocio de salón de belleza y ubicarlo en su casa en el municipio de Corozal.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar todo el equipo necesario para el montaje de este negocio como sillas y lavacabezas.

Este crédito para ella será sumamente importante pues es el inicio de una etapa productiva que le traerá grandes éxitos gracias al apoyo de todas las personas solidarias.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Rosa, 20, is very clear about what she wants to do in her life. She has decided to finish studying in order to get ahead and have a good life, and she wishes to establish a beauty salon in her house, located in Corozal, Colombia. 

She is eager to begin by searching for the resources necessary for her upkeep and her studies. She also wants to help with the household expenses. She is an enterprising and disciplined woman. 

She is asking for a loan to buy all of the equipment needed to start this business, such as chairs and washpoints. This loan will be extremely important to her as it is the start of a productive stage in her life that will bring her great success, thanks to the help of all the people who support her. 

Rosa hopes to make progress as a businesswoman and have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy all the equipment necessary to start a beauty salon, such as chairs and washpoints.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 48 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se ha dedicado desde muy joven a cuidar animales de corral en una hacienda, pero sentía que eso no era suficiente, es por ello que hace 15 años tomo la decisión de instalar una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años de edad y un varón de 12 años de edad. Antonio ha observado que las ganancias de su negocio son la mayor fuente de ingresos de su hogar, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pan dulce, champú, detergente, leche, huevos, café, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, golosinas, etc.
texts.en:
Antonio is 48 years old. He is a man who works hard every day to meet the needs of his household. Since he was very young, he has made a living looking after animals on a farm, however he felt that this was not enough and so, 15 years ago, he took the decision to set up a general store in his home. 

He lives in his own home together with his life partner and their 2 children, a 5 year old daughter and a 12 year old boy. Antonio has observed that the income from his shop is the greatest source of income for his household, and so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy bread and pastries, shampoo, detergent, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, rice, beans, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy bread and pastries, shampoo, detergent, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, rice, beans, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hamza joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his son: Abubakar.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hamza would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hamza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hamza  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his son, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 31-year-old married woman living in Deiralla. She used to sell accessories at home. Recently she started selling blankets to cover needs for the winter. Now Hana is applying for another loan to buy more blankets and bed covers in different sizes to sell them and get more income to help in supporting her five children.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers in different sizes to sell and get more income to help in supporting her five children.

loans.name: Yulis Ester

texts.es:
Yulis, es una mujer de 38 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2010, monto su negocio ofreciendo elementos de papelería con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Yulis se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como útiles, cosméticos, elementos de decoración, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Yulis agradece el apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que con su ayuda hacen lo posible para que los microempresarios colombianos tengan una oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
Yulis is a 38 year old woman. For some time, she has worked in different activities but in her mind she always wanted to get into commerce. That is how at the beginning of 2010, she started her business offering different paper goods items. It has been very popular during the years she has had it. 

Yulis is described as an enterprising, friendly woman with vision and who really wants to get ahead. That is why she decided to ask for a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as school supplies, cosmetics, decoration items, and more. This is to give her business a better image to be able to attract new customers and thus offer them a variety of products to meet their needs and tastes of all who visit her business.   

This way, she will be able to obtain income to continue contributing to her household budget and save to open different branches of her business and thus have a more prosperous future and notably improve her and her family's quality of life.  

Yulis is grateful for the support of Corporación Interactuar and of the people with whose help make it possible for Colombian micro-business people to have an opportunity to progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as school supplies, cosmetics, decoration items, and more.

loans.name: Paola Vanessa

texts.es: Paola es una joven de 25 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres y hermanos, son 5 años que se dedica al comercio de frutas, comenta que viaja a ciudades  lejanas para conseguir su mercadería mas barato, el crédito lo va a invertir en el  compra de frutas, lo que Paola aspira de este negocio es mejorar sus ventas y seguir  trabajando en este negocio familiar que lo hace con sus padres
texts.en: Paola is a 25 year old woman. She lives with her parents and her siblings. For 5 years, she has worked selling fruit. She says that she travels to far away cities to get cheaper merchandise. She is going to invest the loan in buying fruit. What Paola hopes for this business is to improve her sales and keep working in this family business that she has with her parents.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Rosa Del Sagrario

texts.es: Rosa es una señora casada, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 13 años mismos que se encuentran estudiando, Rosa  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, su esposos se dedica al jornal y a sembrar huertas de cultivos de productos propios de su localidad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, lo que Rosa aspira de este negocio es que le queden buenos ingresos y en algún momento comprar una casa ya que en la actualidad vive arrendando.
texts.en: Rosa is a married woman; she has 2 children, ages 11 and 13, who are students. Rosa works raising small animals. Her husband works as a daily laborer and cultivates plots of crops that are typical of the region. The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs; what Rosa hopes from this business is that it gives her a good income and at some point to purchase a house since currently she rents.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es: María es una mujer casada que cuenta con 55 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos ya mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Ella es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su tienda de productos básicos en la que vende: detergente, jabón, champú, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, etc. Pero ella sabe que si invierte en su negocio logrará tener mejores ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, aceite, pan dulce, fideos, queso, paletas, etc. Para surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: María is a 55 year old married woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children who are grown and who help with the household expenses. She is an admirable woman who strives every day to support the home financially through her staple products store where she sells: detergent, soap, shampoo, rice, beans, condiments, etc. But she knows that if she invests in the business she will be able to have better income. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in snacks, oil, sweet bread, pasta, cheese, popsicles, etc. to stock her business and obtain better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in snacks, oil, sweet bread, pasta, cheese, popsicles, etc.

loans.name: Corina Feliza

texts.es: Feliza es una señora casada, tiene 44 años y sus hijos tienen 18, 22,23, Feliza se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos,  su esposo trabaja de chofer, Feliza vive en una casita por la que paga arriendo, vive con su esposo, sus hijos, su madre y una nieta,   Feliza comenta  que cría sus pollos y los vende ya pelados y que lo hace bajo pedido y ofreciendo puerta a puerta,  el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos y seguir adelante en su negocio, Feliza tiene la aspiración de que por medio de su negocio y de los ingresos de su esposo lograr reunir dinero para comprarse un lotecito de terreno para tener donde construir  una casita para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Feliza is a married woman; she is 44 years old and her children are ages 18, 22, and 23. Feliza works raising and selling chickens. Her husband works as a driver. Feliza lives in a small house for which she pays rent. She lives with her husband, her children, her mother, and a granddaughter. Feliza says that she raises her chickens and sells them plucked and she does so to order and by selling them door to door. She needs the loan to purchase chickens and continue on with her business.  Feliza has the goal that through her business and her husband's income, they will be able to save enough money to purchase a small plot of land to be able to build a small house to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
El sonido de máquinas de coser es lo primero que escuchas al entrar al taller de  Omar, donde cose los zapatos que una vez serán usados por niños y adultos, logro asociarse con otras personas que poseían talleres, para que le prestaran las hormas y de esa manera ya no iba solo a coser, sino, crear. Ahora su negocio ha seguido creciendo, así fue aumentando su clientela, luego un pariente lo recomendó a otras personas por su buen desempeño, incrementando sus demandas con mayores pedidos y aumentado sus ganancias de esa manera ha logrado ver mejoras en su economía y ha mejorado las condiciones del negocio. 
Ahora Omar expresa sentirse satisfecho con el apoyo de MiCrédito y piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, solicita el crédito para invertir en material para calzado, como hormas, lona, nailon, que se utilizaran para la creación de zapatos, también para el pago de la mano de obra y alistado de las personas que ayudan a crearlos.  Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para la compra de estos productos que le ayudaran a diversificar y satisfacer las demanda de sus clientes, esto también le ayudara a fortalecer en la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
The sound of sewing machines are the first thing that you hear when you enter Omar's shop, where he sews the shoes that at some point will be used by children and adults. He managed to associate himself with other people who had workshops, so that they loaned him the lasts, and in this way he no longer only sewed, but created.  Now his business has continued growing, as his customer base grew, later a relative recommended him to other people for his quality work, increasing his demand with more orders and increasing his earnings, and in this way he managed to see improvements in his economy and has improved the conditions of his business. 

Now Omar says he is satisfied with MiCrédito's support and plans to continue investing in his business. He asks for a loan to invest in material for footwear, such as lasts, canvas, and nylon, which he will use to make shoes, and also to pay the labor costs and preparation for the people who help him make them. He puts his confidence in the loan for the purchase of these products that will help him to diversify and satisfy his customers' demand, this also will help him to strengthen his family's economy.

loans.use: to invest in footwear materials such as lasts, canvas, and nylon.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of five from Nyamira, a remote town in the Nyanza province of Kenya. She has spent the past ten years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. Alice is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning no feathers on the head. 

Alice wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Alice will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Alice is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. 

Alice awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yohanna is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ishaya Danyaro

texts.en: Ishaya Danyaro is a maize farmer from Auta Makeri village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya Danyaro would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya Danyaro can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ishaya Danyaro, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Agnes owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Agnes operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces challenges of seasonality and transportation. With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is a young man with many dreams.  After years of working with an international coffee export company, Adrien has taken a risk and started his own coffee business. With land in Rwanda's Eastern Providence and an already purchased coffee washing machine, Adrien needs a loan to build the necessary drying tables and storage areas for his new coffee washing company. 

With a loan of 10,000 USD, Adrien expects to hire 70 people in his first washing season. The rains are expected to come early this year, so he needs to construct his tables and storage by mid-January in order not to miss the one coffee season each year.

Adrien has tremendous technical ability, having worked with many washing stations in the past. AEC is providing him with the business support to turn his new venture into an incredibly successful one.

Based on Adrien's experience, strategy, and tenacity, we have no doubt that he will do a great job.  We look forward to sharing his successes over the next several months.

Thank you!

loans.use: To build new drying tables and storage for his coffee washing station

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a person who has faced much difficulty in life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and get ahead with her children. She is a 53-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Miruka, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married and has four children who depend on her for their basic needs. 

For the past 20 years, Alice has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her primary sources of income are milk selling, egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Although she loves dairy farming, she passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” Alice sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. Because of her high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, Alice is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence satisfy the demand. Alice will use her increased income to improve her living conditions. She plans on expanding her business to other towns. Besides increased profits, she will also benefit from more poultry manure, which she will use in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish and hence provide a solid education for her children.

With your help, Alice will be able to make progress with her poultry farming!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Haruna is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Khalid joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abu, Masura and Nasiru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Khalid would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Khalid can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Khalid  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Kiristopa, Felisha and Sheba.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Daniel spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Francisco de 35 años de edad  casado y cuenta con 2 hijas y 2 hijos todos ellos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que  realiza es la siembra de: papas, frijol y maíz. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El uso que  dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de papas se buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Farming is a business activity that is only suitable for people who love the land like a mother and as a giver of the future, a good future full of hopes for following generations.  This is the work that Francisco, age 35, does.  He has two daughters and two sons.  All of them are students at the community school.

Francisco’s business activity is growing potatoes, beans, and corn.  He does this work in the community where he lives.  He sells his products at the local market in Sololá.  He chose this business activity because he has knowledge of how to manage the vegetable crops that he inherited from his father.  His second business activity is working as a day worker in his community.

He will use the loan to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers so that his potato production will be good this year.

One of his biggest dreams is to build some rooms for his children.  He wants to do this so that they have adequate living conditions.  He also dreams of seeing his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: El Casco Group

texts.es:
Para llegar a la comunidad donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo “El Casco” se debe caminar durante varios minutos debido a la falta de transporte. Los habitantes lavan su ropa y transportan agua a sus hogares desde el río más cercano. 

El grupo “El Casco” está integrado por tres mujeres las cuales comparten un vinculo familiar, Doña Concepción y Doña Paula son hermanas y Floriberta es hija de esta última. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron pues muy cerca del lugar donde se reúnen hay una ex hacienda con un letrero que dice “El Casco”.

Floriberta prefieren que la llamen Flor, tiene 32 años de edad y es muy amable, respetuosa, responsable pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, platica que vive con su mamá ya que aún no se ha casado ni tiene hijos.

Flor siempre quiso tener un negocio así que hace 2 años comenzó a vender algunos dulces aprovechando que muy cerca de su casa hay una escuela. Cierto día platicando con un vecino, él le habló de VisionFund, le agrado la forma de trabajo de la institución y cuando le dieron su primer préstamo compró productos de abarrotes y así abrió su propia tienda en casa. Sin embargo, al crecer el negocio y tener cada vez mas mercancía, Flor tuvo que trasladarlo a la casa de su hermana, ya que es un lugar más amplio y se encuentra cerca de la parada principal de autobuses.

Flor debe salir de casa muy temprano para abrir el negocio justo a las siete de la mañana ya que los clientes compran desde esa hora los productos necesarios para preparar el desayuno de sus niños “Estoy ubicada en una buena zona y mis clientes están contentos con mi servicio”. Flor necesita hacer una nueva inversión y comprar alimentos enlatados, azúcar, leche, pan, huevo, refrescos, jugos, detergentes, etc. para incrementar las ganancias y seguir ayudando con los gastos de su hogar. Generalmente ella compra los artículos en los supermercados del municipio porque logra conseguir algunos descuentos. 

Flor cumplió su sueño de tener un negocio propio, pero sabe que aun puede mejorar: necesita un refrigerador más grande para los lácteos y una báscula porque la que se usa actualmente es prestada. Además también le gustaría ofrecer productos de limpieza como cepillos, escobas, jícaras, etc. Espera lograr todo lo que tiene en mente con ayuda de los préstamos de VisionFund y KIVA.  

Paula y Concepción también están seguras de hacer crecer el número de sus borregos y mejorar su calidad de vida con un poco de ayuda y su mayor esfuerzo.

*La foto fue tomada en el municipio donde viven las integrantes, se pueden apreciar los arcos y una parte de la iglesia, Flor es quien viste un abrigo de color rosa.
texts.en:
To get to the community where the "El Casco" group is located, you have to walk several miles because there's no transportation.  The inhabitants  wash their clothing and get water to their houses from the nearest river.  

The "El Casco" group is made up of three women who share a familial link.  Concepción and Paula are sisters, and Floriberta is Paula's daughter.  They chose the group's name because very near where they meet there's a former ranch with a sign that reads "El Casco."

They prefer to call Floriberta Flor.  She's 32, very friendly, respectful, and responsible, but above all very hardworking.   She says she lives with her mother because she's not married yet and doesn't have kids.

Flor always wanted to have her own business, so two years ago she started selling candy, taking advantage of the fact that there's a school right near her house.  One day, as she was chatting with a neighbor, he told her about VisionFund.  She liked how the institution worked and when they gave her her first loan, she bought grocery products and opened up her own store in her house.  However, as the business grew and had more merchandise, Flor had to move to her sister's house, which is much larger and located near the main bus station. 

Flor has to leave her house very early to open the store at 7AM sharp, because at that hour clients buy the products they need to make breakfast for their children.  "I'm located in a good area and my clients are happy with my service." Flor needs to make a new investment in the purchase of canned goods, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, juices, detergents, etc., to increase profit and keep helping out with household expenses.  She generally buys her products in the town supermarkets because she can get some discounts.

Flor realized her dream of having her own business, but she knows it could be even better.  She needs a bigger refrigerator for the dairy and a scale because the one she has is rented.  She would also like to offer cleaning products like brushes, small bowls, etc.  She hopes to achieve everything she has in mind with help from VisionFund and Kiva loans.

Paula and Concepción are also sure they can grow the number of sheep they have and improve quality of life with a little help and their best efforts.

*This photo was taken in the town where the members live.  You can see the arches and part of the church.  Flor is the one in the pink overcoat.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, juices, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción de 32 años de edad, con su compañero de vida han procreado tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad y estudian, en tiempos libre el mayorcito de 9 años le ayuda con las ventas que realiza de su negocio, al igual que su esposo además de realizar labores agrícolas en su pequeña parcela también le ayuda con las ventas sobre todo cuando realiza visitas en las comarcas la acompaña por el peligro que le ocurra algo en los caminos, siendo una familia muy unida y han salido adelante de esta forma.

Doña Concepción es comerciante de Ropa y Calzados Usados, que distribuye a domicilio en las comarcas aledañas de Nueva Guinea,  anteriormente tenía una pulpería en su domicilio al no ser rentable por el crédito que daba y mucha gente no le pago entonces optó por empezar su negocio actual con el mismo capital que le queda de la Pulpería; hacer efectiva sus ventas le es más rentable, ahora sus ganancias son invertidas en su mismo negocio y su manutención familiar.  Su negocio ha crecido pues inició en su domicilio vendiendo a sus vecinos y amigos y ahora se extendió a las comarcas aledañas de modo que cada día crece su clientela.  Tiene la necesidad de este crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, así dar mayor cobertura y variedad a su clientela, comprara 4 pacas de ropa variada seleccionada y una de Zapatos americanos de buena calidad, pues al comprar por mayor el costo de inversión es menor y sus ganancias son más sustanciosas, además con esta inversión su economía familiar mejorara siendo su mayor propósito.

Su próximo proyecto es realizar otro crédito para invertir en las mejoras de su vivienda que con el tiempo se hace necesario realizarle algunas mejoras, poner cerámica, cambiar techo. Poner verjas, siendo posible solo con créditos por la situación económica que los negocios solo estén mantenidos y hay que invertir en los mismos para no descapitalizarse.
texts.en:
Concepción, age 32, and her life partner have three minor children who attend school.  The oldest, age 9, helps her with her business sales during his free time.  Her husband also does so in addition to doing farm work on his small piece of land.  He mostly helps with the sales when she goes to other regions.  He goes with her because of the danger that could be present along her way.  Being a very united family, they have gotten ahead in this way.

Concepción sells used clothes and shoes.  She distributes to homes in the outlying areas of Nueva Guinea.  She previously had a grocery store at her house.  It was not profitable because of the credit that she gave, and many people did not pay her.  She then chose to start her current business with the capital that was left from the grocery store.  Making her sales for cash is more profitable for her.  Now her earnings are invested in her business and the maintenance of her family.

Her business has grown.  She started selling to her neighbors and friends at her house.  Now she has extended into outlying areas in such a way that she gets more customers every day.

She needs this loan to invest in her business.  This way she will have greater coverage and variety for her clientele.  She will buy four bundles of varied clothing and one bundle of American, good quality shoes.  By purchasing in bulk the investment costs less and her earnings are more substantial.  Also, with this investment her family’s finances will improve, which is her biggest aim.

Her next project is to get another loan to makes improvements to her house.  In time it has become necessary to make some improvements, to put down tile, to change the roof, and to install grating.  This is only possible to do with loans because of the financial situation.  In order to maintain the businesses you have to invest in them in order to avoid decapitalization.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Gloria Reina

texts.es: Gloria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus dos hijos y su nuera, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (leche, queso, crema, requeson, etc.)su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor par continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Gloria is fifty-two and lives in her own house with her husband, their two children, and her daughter-in-law.
