She earns her living selling dairy products (milk, cream, cottage cheese, etc.).  Her business is located in her house and she has a lot of clients.  Gloria is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale so she can continue with sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, su hija y su sobrino, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 6 años, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pescado por mayor para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion her daughter and her nephew. She has been working selling fish for 6 years. She sells itinerantly in the different markets that are located close to her house. She is requesting a loan to buy fish wholesale so she makes more profit.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matta joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yakubu, Emnanuel and Deborah. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Matta would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matta can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Matta  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en:
Kahaso is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Kahaso owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kahaso has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maria Yessenia

texts.es: María, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. María tiene 9 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de celulares, accesorios y repuestos, cargadores, memorias USB, baterías etc. Este negocio lo ha puesto en una galera a orilla de la calle donde hay afluencia de clientes y le ha resultado bien. Considera que gracias a los prestamos ha podido mantener activo su negocio. Actualmente solicita otro por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar cargadores, cubiertas y baterías para celulares y vender. Su plan es mejorar el negocio y los ingresos para sacar adelante a la familia.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in the municipality of la Masica, Atlántida. María has had her won business selling cellphones, accessories and parts, chargers USB memory sticks, etc. for 9 years. She has her business in a gallery at the side of the road where there are a lot of clients and things are going well.

She feels that she has been able to keep her business going thanks to the loans. Currently she is requesting another loan for 7,000 NHL to buy chargers, covers and batteries for cellphones to sell. Her plan is to improve her business and income to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy chargers, covers and batteries for cellphones to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Safiratu

texts.en:
Safiratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Safiratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Gidion, Linus and Happy.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Safiratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safiratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Safiratu spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and eventually hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zepora, Jenet and Rose.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un señor viudo, tiene una hija de 17 años que se encuentra estudiando, Juan comenta que al quedarse viudo se quedo solo con la responsabilidad de su hija, Juan se dedica al comercio de paras los fines de semana y también  trabajar de albañil durante la semana, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería de papas, ya que Juan aspira de este negocio es continuar trabajando y  seguir siendo un padre responsable y que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en: Juan is a widower who has a 17 year old daughter who is studying. Juan comments that on becoming a widower he was left with all the responsibility for his daughter. Juan works in commerce on the weekends and during the week he works as a bricklayer. He will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise, potatoes. What Juan wants from this business is to continue to work and be a responsible father so that his daughter can finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Mero

texts.en:
Mero is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mero joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Jimmai, Suleman and Lidiya.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mero would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mero can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new fowl run

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha is a 31-year-old married mother of three children who started two years ago selling accessories from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Racha is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of special accessories to satisfy the customers' needs, and thus, increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. 

Racha hopes to open her own accessories shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of special accessories

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hijo y su hermano, el posee una barbaría ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un sillón para corte de cabello y tijeras profesionales y así poder seguir con su trabajo que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Antonio is 64 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, son and his brother. He has had a barber shop located in his residence for 10 years. With his profits he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy a chair to cut hair and professional scissors. Then he can continue with his work which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy a chair to cut hair and professional scissors.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her best  hope to get back on her feet after her first business went bad.  PMPC lent her money when she needed it the most. 

Now she has another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to pay for labor and seedbed preparation to produce a good harvest. 

Marie Grace perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es: A sus 56 años de edad Aura se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos, y al trabajo al jornal,  ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, de 20, 24 y 25 años, Aura vive en una  casa por la que paga arriendo y vive con sus 2 hijos y 3 nietos que asisten a la escuela, el crédito lo necesita para compra chanchos que los tiene en chancheras, lo que ella aspira de su negocio es seguir trabajando y quedarse viviendo en Ecuador ya que ella es una señora colombiana y dice que esta contenta que en Ecuador le apoyen con el crédito.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Aura raises and sells pigs, and she does day labor. She is a single mother and has 3 children, who are 20, 25, and 25 years old. Aura lives in a house that she is renting, and she lives with 2 of her children and 3 grandchildren, who attend school. 

She needs the loan to buy pigs from pork butchers. Her goal for her business is that she can continue working and that she can stay in Ecuador, since she is Colombian. She says that she is happy that in Ecuador, she has support from loans.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Dimas Alberto

texts.es: Dimas de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 15 años y muchas personas lo buscan por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de herramientas nuevas (palas, taladro, pico, cuchara, etc.) para seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dimas is 50 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife. He has been doing construction work for 15 years, and many people seek him out because of the quality of his work.

He is requesting a loan to buy new tools (shovels, drills, picks, trowels, etc.) to continue with his work, and thus to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy new tools (shovels, drills, picks, trowels, etc.).

loans.name: Hermundo Arturo

texts.es: Arturo es un señor muy alegre, está casado y tiene 5 hijos, Arturo vive con su esposa, 2 hijos  y 2 nietos, ellos residen en el campo donde comenta que los ingresos que tienen son de la agricultura y la ganadería, Arturo necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y de esta manera seguir adelante en su negocio, la aspiración de Arturo es de seguir trabajando y apoyar a sus hijos y nietos en lo que necesiten sobre todo a los que están estudiando.
texts.en: Arturo is a very happy man.  He is married and has 5 children.  Arturo lives with his wife, two children, and two grandchildren.  They live in the country and he notes that their income comes from agriculture and livestock.  Arturo needs a loan in order to buy a cow and in this way move forward with his business.  His goal is to continue working to support his children and grandchildren in all that they need, particularly to help those that are studying in school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Liliam Antonia

texts.es: Liliam, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive con su familia en el Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. En busca de obtener ingresos, hace dos años inicio su propia actividad de elaboración de tamales y tortillas de harina de trigo para vender,  los tamales están hechos de masa de maíz, relleno con carne de pollo, papas, aceitunas, chicharos y arroz. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF, por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar leña, hojas de banano, harina de maíz y de trigo, condimentos, arroz, papas, pollo, manteca y otros insumos para la elaboración de tamales y tortillas. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y formar una familia digna con buena educación.
texts.en: Liliam is 41 years old, is married, and has three children.  She lives with her family in the city of Gracias, in Lempira, Honduras.  In search of ways to make a living, two years ago she began her own business making tamales and wheat flour tortillas to sell.  The tamales are made from corn meal, filled with chicken, potatoes, olives, peas and rice.  She is asking for her second loan from Kiva partner ODEF. She needs 12,000 Lempiras (Honduran currency) in order to purchase firewood, banana leaves, corn and wheat flour, condiments, rice, potatoes, chicken, butter and other items for making tamales and tortillas.  Her plan is to grow her business and to raise her family with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, banana leaves, corn and wheat flour, condiments, rice, potatoes, chicken, butter and other items for making tamales and tortillas

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 45-year-old married man living in Ajloun. His project started two years ago when he retired from the armed forces. He became bored in life, so he opened a small part of a supermarket. The reason that lead Samer to apply for the loan is to add new kinds of nuts and a new coffee grinder.

loans.use: to add new kinds of nuts and a new coffee grinder.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: A sus 78 años de edad Maria se dedica a la comercialización de papas, ella comenta que vive sola, tiene 5 hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad y no viven con ella, el crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería en papas, para comprar en el campo y luego se traslada a otras ciudades para vender su producto, la aspiración de Maria es seguir trabajando para cubrir sus gastos diarios sobretodo de alimentación y de salud.
texts.en:
At 78 years old, Maria sells potatoes. She says that she lives by herself. She has 5 children, but all of them are adults and no longer live with her. 

She needs the loan to buy potatoes. She buys them from the farms, and then she transports them to other cities to sell. Her goal is to continue working to cover her daily expenses, which above all include food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Remigio Bernardo

texts.es: Remigio es un señor que vive en el campo, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 9 años y se encuentran estudiando, Remigio juntamente con su esposa se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que dice que esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos en para su familia, la aspiración de Remigio es seguir trabajando y que sus hijos estudien hasta que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Remigio is a man that lives in the country. He is 47 years old, is married, and has 2 children, who are 7 and 9 years old and who are studying. Remigio, together with his wife, works in agriculture and livestock.

He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow, since he says that this activity is the source of income for his family. Remigio’s goal is to continue working and for his children to study until they are professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: comfort.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isah spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Jorge tiene 49 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos por quienes está decidido a realizar una lucha para trabajar todos los días, sus dos hijos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza con tanto empeño es la compra y venta de abarrotaría dicha actividad lo realiza en la comunidad donde el vive, el lo aprendió de su hermano desde hace 23 años y deja buena ganancia y un ingreso económico para el beneficio de el y la de su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para tener su tienda surtido de mercadería para que pueda servir a la clientela con los productos que el pone a la disposición.

Uno de sus sueños es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse profesionales en los diferentes campos de la vida y por medio de las ganancias que le genere su negocio el quiere comprar terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Life gave him an opportunity to work as employee of a general store. This is what he was hoping for, not just an open door, but what was waiting behind that door. He found what he wanted to do.

Jorge is 49 years old. He is married, with two children for whom he is determined in his efforts to strive at work every day. His two children are excellent students at the local public school.

He makes a living buying and selling groceries in the town where he lives. He learned from his brother and has been at this work for 23 years. It generates good profits and a household income for the benefit of Jorge and his family, allowing for improvement in their life conditions.

He will use the loan to buy goods to keep his grocery store well stocked and thus serve his customers.

One of his dreams is to see his children become professionals in life. With his earnings from work, he wants to buy land for them.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Mikaila

texts.en:
Mikaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mikaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Safayanu, Sule and Tsahiru.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mikaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mikaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Mikaila spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bilya and David.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Isah spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rashila

texts.en:
Rashila is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rashila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rashila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Rashila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sule joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Miracle and Hezekiah.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Sule spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Inusa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Burus village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Matta

texts.en: Matta is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matta joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mathew, Nuhu and Hannatu.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Matta would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matta can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Matta  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahilla

texts.en:
Rahilla is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahilla joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Titus, Parasser and Lidiya.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahilla would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahilla can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rahilla  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es una señora casada, tiene 23 años de edad y sus 3  hijos tienen 3 años, 7 años y 3 meses, el esposo de Fernanda se dedica  atrabajar en el jornal y en la agricultura, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo necesita para comprar chonchos ya que comenta que de aquí le queda ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y sobre todo para lo que necesiten sus hijos para ir a la escuela.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a married woman. She is 23 years old, and her 3 children are 3 years old, 7 years old, and 3 months old. Fernanda’s husband is a day laborer and works in agriculture. She raises animals.

She needs a loan to buy pigs, since she says that it will allow her to earn income to support her husband with the household expenses, and to ensure that her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es: Maria es una joven de 27 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, sus dos hijas tiene 6 y 10 años mismas que asisten a la escuela, Maria vive en la casa de sus padres y ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y también trabaja al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, ya que comenta Maria que trabaja duro para cubrir los gastos diarios que hacen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is young woman, who is 27 years old. She is a single mother, and her two daughters are 6 and 10 years old; they attend school. Maria lives in her parents’ house, and she raises animals and is a day laborer.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens. Maria says that she works hard to cover her children’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana es una señora de 54 años de edad, ella esta casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, Ana vive con su esposo, 3 hijas y 4 nietos, el esposo de Ana trabaja al jornal de actividades de agricultura, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos que los aria en unos pequeños galpones, la aspiración de Ana es de mejorar su negocio y apoyar a sus nietos con los gastos de educación.
texts.en: Ana is a 54 year old woman. She is married and has 4 children who are adults. Ana lives with her husband, 3 daughters and 4 grandchildren. Ana's husband works as a day labor in agriculture. She needs the loan to buy chickens that she will raise in some small sheds. Ana's wish is to improve her business and support her grandchildren with the cost of their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en: Immacule is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 5 and 19. All of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell at the market. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 40 years old and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Annaliza is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annaliza has been in this business  for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Iliya expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abuheri

texts.en:
Abuheri, who is in his late 40s, is married with five children and all of them are still in school.  He has been selling fish for seven years now.  He works from 6 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Abuheri's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his stock of fish and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to to pay school fees, bought a plot of land,  and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his stock and sell to many clients.  He dreams of building his own house.  

Abuheri will make sure he pays back the loan according to the loan's schedule.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fish and sell to many clients.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 44 years old. She is married with seven children, aged between 5 and 23 years; six of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for 22 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the insurance for her children and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to resell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 27 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business, such as fish nets.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years now and earns additional income from bicycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, such as fish nets.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 61 years old and married with 6 children. With one child in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them. Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc. Aida has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Aida would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 15 years. All of them go to school. She has a shop and has been doing business for 16 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 35 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. Emma raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year. 

Emma requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid, who is in her mid 50s, is married with five children and all of them are grown-ups.  She has been a food vendor for fourteen years now.  She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mwanaid's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the mamalishe (little restaurant) stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy  chairs and tables and restock the missing items in her mamalishe.  She dreams of owning a hotel.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group "Lindi" which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  chairs and tables and restock the missing items in her mamalishe (little restaurant).

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annaliza is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Annaliza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Annaliza has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 32 years old and has two children. Carmela is married and both of her children are in school.

Carmela is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmela has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children. One child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has been in a bicycle transport business in the Philippines for 3 years. Alma requested a 7000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for her business.  In the future, Alma would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Juaneras Group

texts.en:
The women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Juaneras”, who live in San Juan La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlan, are determined to rise above poverty and empower themselves and their families. Last March, the group received their first loan  that was funded by KIVA investors. The women are proud to share that they have successfully completed this loan cycle and are requesting a new loan that will be their second, fully confident that they will be able to pay it back on time and in full. 

Telma is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 29 years old and is a single mother raising two children. She is both father and mother to her children, a role that is often challenging. She has worked hard to send both of her children to school. Telma has a natural dye business and also makes textiles like scarves, shawls and table runners. She is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase thread to dye with natural colorants (local plants, tree bark, corn husks). Her ultimate goal is to have enough income so that her children can complete the highest level of education and enter a profession.

The educational components of the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank have helped Telma and her friends. With the information that they receive through role-playing, games and drawings, the women learn about self-esteem and empowerment. The ladies learn to become effective business women with new information about business administration, budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service. They also learn about common diseases, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants.  Friendship Bridge calls this combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is most effective.

loans.use: To purchase thread to dye with natural colorants (local plants, tree bark, corn husks)

loans.name: El Ensueno Group

texts.en:
Symptoms of poverty are found everywhere in Guatemala where income is scarce and people feel hopeless. The lack of money often translates to lack of food that leads to stunting and malnutrition. The lack of funding to buy clothing and supplies keeps children working alongside their parents and unable to attend school. During the rainy season, roofs leak and dirt floors turn into a muddy mess that leads to other problems. 

Inés is a young 19-year-old student and small business owner from Santa Cruz del Quiche who belongs to the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Ensueno”. Along with her mother, Inés has a “tortilleria” where tortillas are made fresh three times each day. The mother-daughter team started the business three years ago to help to meet the expenses of the household that includes five other children. This is the first loan cycle for this enterprising woman and she is most excited. She is requesting a loan to purchase a gas stove to make more tortillas because this is a busy time of the year with graduations and year end parties. 

There are five other ladies in the Trust Bank. The women work in various businesses including animal husbandry and commercial ventures like clothing sales, as well as the sale of smoothies. Another member has a convenience store. These women learn to manage their businesses gaining useful tools at their monthly meetings, when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares pertinent information about effective business management practices, health, hygiene, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. The women learn about self-esteem and empowerment as well.

In providing the funding for these much-needed loans, KIVA investors are greatly appreciated for their kindness and generosity. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on the “Ensueno” Trust Bank in the very near future.

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove to make more tortillas because this is a busy time of the year with graduations and year-end parties.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Estila

texts.en:
Estila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estila is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

Estila has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional equipment to use in her business.

Estila has been in this business for one year. In the future, Estila  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment to use in her business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estelita is 49 years old now.

Estelita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additonal stocks of fruits to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Estelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 39 years old and has one child in school.

Gina has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gwedolyn

texts.en:
Gwedolyn is 28 years old and married with four children, all of her children are in school. Gwedolyn works very hard to provide for them.

Gwedolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like junk food, beverages, canned goods, etc..

Gwedolyn has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Gwedolyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like junk food, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 52 years old and married with six children. Hermenia works very hard to provide for them.

Hermenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Hermenia has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Hermenia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials to use in her manicure and pedicure business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in her business

loans.name: Betzy Mariana

texts.es: La idea de negocio de Betzy, se dio gracias a la motivación de no querer depender económicamente de sus esposo, por el contrario deseaba tener otra actividad que ejercer aparte de sus responsabilidades en el hogar. Impulsada por una amiga, quien le propuso vender productos de empresas especializadas en venta mediante catálogos, inició su negocio y al darse cuenta de los excelentes resultados que obtuvo, incursiono en el comercio de productos de marroquinería y ropa.  Actualmente alterno a su negocio, trabaja en una empresa y sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago, mientras  sus compras las realiza en almacenes ubicados en el centro del municipio de Barranquilla, Medellín y Maicao de contado;  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará conjuntos deportivos, jeans y calzado.  Ella esta realizando esta inversión para cobijar un mercado mas amplio y obtener mayores ganancias.  Betzy tiene 35 años de edad, sueña con comprarles una casa a sus hijos un niño de 4 años y una joven de 14 años de edad. Su meta en el negocio a futuro es tener un almacen.
texts.en: Betzy, 35, only had her husband's income before and decided to start a business to earn an income of her own.  A friend suggested that she buy merchandise from catalogs and resell the merchandise for a profit.  She liked the idea and started a business buying and selling clothing and leather goods.  Betzy's main customers are her co-workers at a company where she herself now works and she says that seeing them every day makes collections easy.  She now buys the merchandise she sells, for cash, from stores in Barranquilla, Medellín, and Maicao.  Betzy is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy shoes, jeans and sportswear.  The investment will allow her to broaden the range of merchandise she sells and, in turn, increase her earnings.  For the future, Betzy hopes to buy a house for her, her 14-year old daughter and 4-year old son.  She also hopes to open a store of her own one day.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old and has five children. Estela is married and has two children who are in school.

Estela is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estela has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mahpurat

texts.ru: Махпурат 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Махпурат - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Махпурат с мужем занимаются животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 20 овец. На участке мерою 3,0 Га собственной и 3,0 Га арендованной земли, она выращивает пшеницу, клевер, кукурузу, малину и персиковые деревья. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махпурат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Махпурат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mahpurat is 52 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Mahpurat has a secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, Mahpurat and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2009. Thanks to their hard work, today their farm contains 2 cows and 20 sheep. Mahpurat grows wheat, clover, corn, raspberries and peaches on 3.0 hectares of owned and 3.0 hectares of leased land. Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mahpurat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two cows to increase her livestock headcount. Mahpurat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into continuing to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 30 лет, не замужем, детей нет. Образование среднее, на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, на участке мерою 1,25 Га она выращивает пшеницу и клевером. Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. На полученные доходы от кредита Жамила планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота, чтобы иметь возможность помогать своей пожилой маме.
texts.en: Zhamila is 30 years old, not married and does not have children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 5 years after starting this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhamila's hard work, today their farm contains 2 cows, 15 sheep, and 1.25 hectares of land, where she grows wheat and clover. Zhamila requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy one cow. Zhamila plans to further increase her livestock headcount with the earnings from this loan in order to be able to help her elderly mother.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland. He hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children, Sha, Aibu and Basiru, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 32 years old and has six children, three in school, Josefina works very hard to provide for her family.

Josefina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Josefina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Josefina has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Josefina is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and beverages.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 37 years old and married with six children, three in school. Lea works very hard to provide for her family.

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, and shampoo.

Lea has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, and shampoo.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 40 years old and married with four children, all in school. Leonora works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like diapers, canned goods, beverages, and groceries..

Leonora has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like diapers, canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Diana Leonor

texts.es: Diana, encontró en las empresas especializadas en ventas por catalogo la mejor elección para generar ingresos y estar siempre al lado de su familia, fue así que desde el año 2008 ella comercializa productos para el cuidado del cabello y piel, maquillaje, joyas, perfumes y accesorios.  Sus principales clientes son sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago, mientras sus compra las realiza de contado. En la actualidad Diana esta aplicando a un financiamiento en la  Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertirlo en la compra de productos cosméticos y cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes. Diana tiene 38 años y sueña con tener su casa propia, su gran desafío es que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para cubrir la cantidad de pedidos que le requieren, su meta para el negocio a futuro es tener vitrinas mostradoras con productos y también le gustaría abrir una peluquería.
texts.en: Diana, 38, buys cosmetics from catalogs and resells them to her customers.  It is the best business for her, she says, because she can earn an income and still go on managing her household and caring for her family.  She started the business in 2008, buying and selling makeup, perfumes and other beauty products.  Her customers are largely drawn from family, friends and neighbors so collecting payment for sales is easy, she says.  She buys the merchandise for cash.  Diana is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a loan that she will use to stock her business and meet customer demand.  Her biggest challenge, she says, is that she doesn't always have the funds to pay for the merchandise she needs to stock her business.  For the future, she wants to buys display cases for displaying her merchandise and open a hair salon.  She also hopes to buy a house one day.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Adriana Ximena

texts.es: Ximena es una señora de 33 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica  a la ganadería y a la agricultura, juntamente con su esposo también trabajan al jornal, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca para tenerlo en terrenos por los que paga arriendo, la aspiración mas grande de su Ximena es de que le siga yendo bien en su negocio y así logar que no les haga falta lo necesario para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en: Ximena is a 33 year old woman who has two children who go to school. She works with livestock and in agriculture together with her husband who also works as day labor. She needs the loan to buy a cow to put on the land that they lease. Ximena's biggest dream is to continue doing well in her business and in doing so ensure that her children don't lack anything and continue to study.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Shehu Makama

texts.en: Shehu Makama is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shehu Makama joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Inusa and Sha'aibu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu Makama would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu Makama can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Shehu Makama spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are well educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusufu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusufu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Mohammudu, Adulhadu and Zaharadini.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusufu would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusufu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yusufu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Peter would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Peter can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Peter is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a maize farmer from Daura village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Aminu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es madre de un hijo, que con mucho sacrificio está luchando para obtener su título universitario de docente, para poder tener un mejor estilo de vida que dar a su hijo.
Comenta que es muy difícil su tarea de ser madre y estudiante, pero que está luchando para poder ser un ejemplo para su hijo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mirian has one son.  She is studying for a teaching degree, a commitment that requires much sacrifice on her part now but that will eventually pay off in a better standard of living for her and her little boy.
Mirian says that being a mom and a student is difficult but she forges ahead to set a good example for her son.  She is applying for a loan to pay her university fees so that she can continue working towards her teaching degree.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 02 Avril 2007 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre. Le banc villageois est à son quinzième cycle ce qui fait que les femmes en majorité jouissent d’une bonne expérience dans le petit commerce qui constitue leur activité  principale, elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Sona (debout à gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille et  04 garçons. Elle fait parti des membres fondateurs du banc villageois. Elle est très dynamique et s’active dans la vente de miel, huile de palme et autres produits de la cueillette. Elle s’approvisionne en Guinée Bissau en grande quantité pour la revente au détail dans la capitale sénégalaise.

Avec son crédit, elle compte acheter 20 bidons de 20 litres de miel et 15 de bidons pour l’huile de palme.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille : nourriture, scolarité et santé des enfants et aussi accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on April 2, 2007 at the inauguration of the local banc villageois. The group includes women who live in the same village. Their relations are marked by a spirit of solidarity and mutual help. The banc vilalgeois is on its 15th loan cycle, and thus most women have a long  experience as vendors, which is their main business activity. They also do farming on rain-fed land.

Mrs. Sona (the one standing on the left raising her hand) is our star borrower. She is married and has four children: one daughter and four sons. She is one of the founding members of the banc villageois. She is very energetic and works selling honey, palm oil and other products. She stocks up wholesale in Guinea Bissau in order to resell retail in the capital city of Senegal.

With her loan, she plans to buy 20 jugs of honey (20 liters/21 quarts each) and 15 jugs of palm oil. 
Thanks to her revenue, she plans to help her husband provide for family needs: food, schools fees, and healthcare expenses for their children. She also plans to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy 20  20-liter jugs of honey and 15 jugs of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to establish a block of better pasture for improved feeding of the livestock, particularly in the summer when the grass is often dry

loans.name: Oigulhon

texts.ru: Ойгулхон 38 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Ойгулхон - среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2010 году, благодаря упорному труду Ойгулхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова с теленком, а на земельной доле мерою 1,11 Га она выращивает малину, кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ойгулхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка. Доходы от кредита Ойгулхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Oigulhon is 38 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. Oigulhon has a secondary education. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2010. Thanks to Oigulhon's hard work, today her farm contains a cow with a calf, and 1.11 hectares  of land, where she grows raspberries, corn and clover for the farm use and sale. In order to further develop her business, Oigulhon requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a calf. Oigulhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and saving money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase one calf to fatten and resell in order to grow her business

loans.name: Rosa Pastora

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos de los mismos que 3 aun viven con ella, sus 3 hijos asisten  a la escuela, Rosa necesita el crédito para comprar pollos que los tiene en un lugarcito que le presta su madre para criar pollos, ya que Rosa vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y  ahí no le dejan criar animales, Rosa también se dedica a trabajar al jornal,la aspiración de Rosa es mejorar su negocio y de ser posible le gustaría comprar un lotecito para tener donde criar los chanchos y los demás animales menores que cría.
texts.en: Rosa is 47 years old. She is a single mother of 7 children, 3 of whom still live with her and go to school. Rosa needs the loan to buy chickens that she keeps in a small space that her mother gave her to raise chickens. Rosa lives in a house which they lease and she is not allowed to raise animals there. Rosa also works as day labor. Rosa's wish is to improve her business and if possible buy a small lot where she can raise pigs that the other small animals that she raises.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
ocio es de la ciudad de concepción, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder también ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Está estudiando la carrera de técnico en enfermería, para que por medio de ello pueda realizar su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus sueños. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Rocio lives in Concepción.  She is a hard worker, committed to making life better for herself and her neighbors.  She is studying nursing and says that getting her nursing degree will be a means to a better life for her.  
Rocio is applying for a loan that she will use to pay her university fees so that she can carry on her studies. She is grateful for this opportunity and says that your loans will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is a 38-year-old married woman, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liliosa has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

Liliosa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Liliosa would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her bicycle, and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 29 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Замиры - высшее образование, она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы и 12 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства Замира старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку одной дойной коровы. Замира является лидером группы "Жетиген", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, она очень уважаемая и умеет вести бизнес. Замира планирует увеличить доходы от бизнеса и направить прибыль на постройку нового дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zamira is 29 years old, married and a mother of 2 school-age children. Zamira has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to Zamira's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows and 12 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). Zamira tries to invest her savings into developing and expanding her business. Zamira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow. Zamira is the leader of the "Jetigen" group that, besides her, consists of two more persons. She is very respected and knows how to run her business well. Zamira plans to increase her business income and use the profit to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to grow her business

loans.name: Satylgan

texts.ru: Сатылган, 61 год, женат, есть 4 детей. Сатылган в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Сатылгана, на сегодняшний день у него есть 3 коровы, также он выращивает на собственном участке мерою 3,0 ГА клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Satylgan is 61 years old, married and has 4 children. To provide the primary income for his family, he has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years. Thanks to Satylgan's hard work, today he has 3 cows and 3.0 hectares of owned land, where he grows clover. His monthly income amounts to at least 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business, Satylgan requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow. Satylgan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing his business and repairing his house.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to increase his milk sales

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis está estudiando para ser un excelente técnico en enfermería, es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que está luchando.
Se está esforzando bastante y es por ello que se está destacando. El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en: Luis is working on a nursing degree.  He hopes to make the most of his life and is studying nursing to fulfill that ambition.  You can only stand out, he says, if you make the commitment to do so.  Luis is applying for a loan that he will use to pay his university fees so that he can carry on his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 18 y 14  años, el menor estudia en colegio y el mayor está esperando entrar en la universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña María es una muy buena madre y esposa que realiza varias actividades para tener sus ingresos  por el bienestar de su familia, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos y chanchos, también vende deliciosos helados que ella misma prepara y que son muy apetecidos por sus vecinos, gracias a los créditos ella también puede ayudarle a su marido el cual tiene un taxi y requiere de dinero para ciertos arreglos que necesita el carro, de esta forma y trabajando en conjunto ellos  sacan adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para los animales y repuestos para el taxi. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les sirven de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In La Mocora, part of Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the 'La Macora' communal bank meet every fortnight. It is a a place known for it's hard-working people who work in agriculture and raising livestock.

María lives in this place. She is 48 years old, married and from this relationship has two children aged 18 and 14. The younger studies in school and the oldest is waiting to enter university. Her husband is a driver.

María is a good mother and wife who does a number of businesses to bring in income for the well-being of her family. She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs, She also sells delicious ice-cream that she makes herself. that is appreciated by her neighbors.

Thanks to the loans she has also been able to help her husband who has a taxi and needs money to fix things on the vehicle. In this way, working together with her husband, they get the family ahead. This loan is to buy food and medicine for her animals and parts for the taxi. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it as the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her animals and to buy parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Sani Sambo

texts.en: Sani Sambo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sani Sambo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yusuf, Salamatu and Hauwa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani Sambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Sani Sambo can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sani Sambo  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. Eventually he hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old, widowed, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lydia operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Lydia requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items such as canned goods and beverages to sell. In the future, she   would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Margarett Jhoany

texts.es: Margarett, tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera vive junto a su padre en Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. ella es una persona muy emprendedora, estuvo estudiando y hace dos años decidió por tener su propio negocio de un salón de Belleza y lo pudo instalar en su casa con el apoyo de su padre. Ofrece los servicios de alisado, corte de cabello, secado, aplicación de tintes, decoración de uñas, etc.. esta encantada con su negocio. Además vende productos como champú, cremas y tratamientos para el cabello. Está solicitando el segundo préstamo a la institución por la cantidad de 21,000 lempiras para comprar cremas, tintes, champú, uñas acrílicas, esmaltes y tratamientos para aplicar a los clientes y para vender. Aprovechara esta temporada de alta demanda para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a establecer una academia para enseñar belleza y tener un buen patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Margarett, 24, is single and lives with her father in Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. She is a very entrepreneurial person. She used to be a student, and two years ago she decided to have her own beauty salon business and was able to set one up in her house with the help of her father. 

She offers services such as straightening hair, cutting hair, blow-drying, hair-dying, nail decoration, etc. She is in love with her shop. Additionally, she sells products such as shampoo, creams and treatments for hair. 

Margarett is asking for a second loan from this institution in the quantity of 21,000 lempiras to buy creams, dyes, shampoo, acrylic nails, nail polish and treatments to use with clients and to sell. She makes good use of this time of high demand to boost her sales and her income. Her dream is to be able to establish a school to teach beauty and to have a good family estate.

loans.use: to buy creams, dyes, shampoo, some acrylics, nail polishes and treatments to use with clients and also sell.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a maize farmer from Danlawal village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sule, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Kwalo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: M. Ghali

texts.en: M.Ghali is a maize farmer, and a member of Babban Gona. M.Ghali joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Abdullahi, Khalil and Fatimah. Before he became a Babban Gona member, M.Ghali would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, M.Ghali can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, M.Ghali  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase additional items to sell, such as school supplies, canned goods, shampoo, etc.. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as school supplies, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Zhumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул, 33 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Жумагул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 4 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Жумагул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 15 овец. На земельном участке мерою 0,59 Га выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zhumagul is 33 and married with three children. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for four years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 0.59 hectares of land where she grows corn and wheat. Her total business brings in monthly revenue of about 10,000 KGS.

Having concluded that her business is profitable, Zhumagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase three cows. She plans to put profits from the loan into further building up her farm.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Yohanna Amadu

texts.en:
Yohanna Amadu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his three children. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yhe would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna Amadu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. He hopes to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her three children.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahab would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahab can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. She plans to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store maize at harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Lorna

texts.en:
As the parent of one child, Ma. Lorna works hard to support her family.
