She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items. Ma. Lorna is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Marie Ysabel

texts.en:
Marie Ysabel is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 21 years old now.

Marie Ysabel has a processed food business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marie Ysabel has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eduardo Ricardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven que vive en el campo, tiene 23 años de edad, el es soltero y vive con sus padres y hermano,  comenta que son 6 años que se dedica a la crianza de vacas lecheras  para vender la leche y así lograr tener buenos ingresos de su negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, y de este negocio Eduardo espera juntar algo de capital para retomar los estudios que los dejo hace 2 años por falta de recursos económicos y por vivir muy retirado de la ciudad donde existen las universidades.
texts.en:
23-year old Eduardo lives in the countryside. He is single and lives with his parents and brother. For six years now he has been raising milk cows so he can sell the milk and earn money from this business.

He is seeking a loan to buy a milk cow. From his business Eduardo hopes to gather enough money to go back to school. He had to stop going two years ago because he didn’t have enough money and because he lives a long way from the city where the universities are located.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Marigen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Marigen is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell though her general store business, like shampoo, cigarettes, and beverages.

Marigen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, cigarettes, and beverages.

loans.name: Gilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Gilma de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilma is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. For many years she has made a living making and selling tortillas. She runs her business from her house and has lots of customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy sweetcorn by the hundred kilo and limes so she can continue making the tortillas. This will help her make more of a profit and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweetcorn by the hundred kilo and limes.

loans.name: Tatiana Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señorita Tatiana, tiene 32 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, ella hace varios años aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia en la ciudad de Portoviejo. 
Doña Tatiana  es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudarles a sus padres ya que ellos son de escasos recursos a así salir adelante, ella tiene un salón de belleza en su casa, allí realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios, también en su local  vende productos y tratamientos de belleza y cosméticos. Lleva más de 11 años con su salón y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y ciertas herramientas que aun necesita. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un SPA
texts.en:
The La Mocora community of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo is well- known for its hardworking people who make a living by farming and cattle ranching. The members of the La Mocora communal bank meet every two weeks. 

This is where Tatiana lives. She is 32 years old, single and lives in her parents' house. Several years ago, she learned about beauty and personal grooming in an academy in the city of Portoviejo. 

Tatiana is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own salary so she can help her parents out because they are not very well off. She runs her own beauty salon from her house, where she carries out a variety of jobs like dying, cutting hair, painting nails and other things. 

She works from Monday to Saturday from 8 am until 8 pm and sometimes later if her customers need her services. In addition, she sells beauty products and treatments and cosmetics in her salon. She has been doing this for more than 11 years and now has a lot of customers so business is going well. 

She is going to use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, and tools that she still needs for the beauty salon. She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she gets from the bank. Her dream is to have her own spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents and tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Lawal joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bahari, Zainaf, and Aminu.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Lawal spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 36 years old and married, with three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Virginia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Virginia has requested PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. 

Virginia is committed to rebuild and, in the future, would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 39 years old and has six children who are in school.

Marites has a food production business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Marites has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 48 years old and married with six children, two attend school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita has run a general store for 5 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy eggs, shampoo, and canned goods.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy eggs, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Letumau

texts.en:
Letumau is a 38-year-old married woman with 6 children.  She has a small plantation and grows cucumbers, beans, tomatoes, and cabbages to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 3 years.

 Letumau has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Letumau hopes to pay  her children's school fees and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives,and chemicals.

loans.name: Tulipe

texts.en:
Tulipe is a 55-year-old woman who is married, with four children. She runs a business selling daily goods in her community, like chicken, tinned fish, corned beef, sugar, flour, salt, and soft drinks. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Tulipe has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, corned beef, a freezer, coolers, daily goods, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, corned beef, coolers, a freezer, etc.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 02 Avril 2007 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre. Le banc villageois est à son quinzième cycle ce qui fait que les femmes en majorité jouissent d’une bonne expérience dans le petit commerce qui constitue leur activité  principale, elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mariama  (debout à  l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, est  mariée et mère de 06  enfants dont 02 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’investi dans la vente de poissons qu’elle achète au marché de poisson de Yarang pour la revente dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle fait au moins une rotation par semaine. De même elle détient une table pour la vente de condiments et divers bouillons culinaires. 
 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter par bassine ou panier 02 à 03 de poisson par rotation pour la revente par tas où par pièce. 

Les bénéfices lui servent d’une part à prendre en charge certains besoins de la famille scolarité, habillement et santé et d’autres part à accroître son épargner.
texts.en:
This group was created on April 2, 2007 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. Within the group are women who all live in the same village. They share the values of solidarity and mutual assistance, which characterize their actions and their inter-member relations. The banc villageois is on its fifteenth loan cycle, which have made the majority of the women enjoy a good experience in the small trades that make up their main businesses. They also do rain-based agriculture.

Ms. Mariama (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of six children, two of whom are girls and four of whom are boys. She invests herself in the sale of fish which she buys at the Yarang fish market to resell in her village and the weekly markets. She makes at least one rotation per week. Likewise, she keeps a table for the sale of vegetables for sauces and various cooking broths. With this new loan, she expects to buy two or three rounds of fish by the basin or basket to resell by the pile or by individual fish. The profits will serve in part to care for her family's schooling, clothing and health needs and in part to grow her savings.

loans.use: to purchase two or three rounds of fish, by the basin or basket, to resell by the pile or by individual fish

loans.name: Norestela Yamileth

texts.es: Norestela, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo y reside junto a su padre en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Ella es muy emprendedora trabaja unas horas en un molino de café y luego sale a vender ropa ambulantemente en la comunidad, ofrece pantalones, camisas, blusas, y ropa interior. El negocio de venta de ropa lo tiene hace dos años. Con el fin de surtir de mas ropa para aprovechar la temporada de mayor demanda, ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, y ropa interior. Su plan es continuar con el negocio y el empleo para apoyar a su hijo con la educación y a sus padres y lograr tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Norestela is 27 years old and is s single mother of one son. She lives with her father in the Morazan municipality in Yoro. 

She is very hard-working, putting in a few hours in a coffee mill and then going on to sell clothes on the streets in her local area. She offers trousers, shirts, blouses and underwear. She has been running this business for two years. 

With a view to stocking more clothes so she can make the most of the busiest time of year, she has requested a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and underwear. Her plan is to keep up her business and her job to pay for her son's education, help out her parents, and achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 30-year-old married woman with seven children, five attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelly has had a retail fish business for 15 years and requests  9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila grows maize. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to store maize.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 45-year-old married woman with eight children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has raised pigs for 2 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to serve his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Emmanuel expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and, in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the need to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Virginia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc. for her general store business. Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a 32-year-old married woman with three children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sheila has had a  scrap business for 2 years and requests 8,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy additional items for her business.

In the future, Sheila would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Wilma has had a fishing business for 5 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

 In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Isiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiya would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Isiya expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, move to the  city with his family.

loans.use: to store maize.

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is a 59-year-old married woman with six children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Villa has had a retail ready-to-wear business for 2 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items for the business.

In the future, Villa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for the business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a general store  and earns additional income from fishing. Virginia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, shampoo, and beverages for her general store.

Virginia has  sustained her business activities through  3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Victoria joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Isuwa and Yakubu.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Victoria would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to  meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Victoria  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children to ensure that they are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store maize.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bilya, Kefas and Christopher.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isah  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to store maize.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas mayores de edad, la menor aun vive con ella. El marido es chofer. 
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que además se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  helados, artículos de bazar y papelería, legumbres entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden, pero por lo general es ella la que esta atenta a las necesidades de sus clientes. Lleva más de 17 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y productos de bazar y papelería. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para seguir adelante. Sus sueños es que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The micro-credit group La Mocora meets in the neighborhood of La Mocora in the city Portoviejo. The city is known for its hard working people, its agricultural work and livestock raising. The group meets every fifteen days.

This is where Maria lives. She is 53 years old and she has a long time relationship with the father of her three daughters, two of whom are now adults and a third who still lives with her. Her husband works as a driver.

Maria is both a housewife and an entrepreneur. She has a grocery store she runs from her home. She sells a wide range of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, ice cream, bazaar items and stationary. She works from 7am to 10pm and sometimes even later. Her daughter and her husband help her run her business but she is the one who is generally there attending to the customers. She has run her business for more than 17 years and things are going well.

This loan will be used to stock her store and help her buy rice, oil, detergent, sausages, bazaar products and stationary. She has been with the micro-credit group since its inception and she likes the help she receives from the organization. Her dream is to see her store grow more with every passing day.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent etc.

loans.name: Letisina

texts.en:
Leitisina is a 24-year-old woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows cucumbers, cabbages, and beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Leitisina has requested a loan to buy wires, fertilizer,and seeds. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Leitisina will use the profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wires, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Faamaini

texts.en:
Faamaini is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. 

Faamaini has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Faamaini will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, a bag of sugar, oil and yeast.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 50-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business. 

Elisa has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, materials, needles, threads.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria tiene 58 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 25 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old.  She lives in her own home with her family.  For 25 years she has had a small store in her place of residence.  She has a lot of customers due to her good prices and her friendly customer service.  

She is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic staples, drinks, snacks, pastries, etc.  In this way, she can have a higher income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic staples, drinks, snacks, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Albina Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Albina, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos pero uno falleció, los otros 7 ya son  mayores de edad, una de sus hijas  aun viven con ella. Su esposo  ya no trabaja por razones de salud.
Doña Albina es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le gusto trabajar para tener sus ingresos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatillas por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella también hace poco empezó a vender comida los fines de semana, vende meriendas y le deja buenos ingresos. Trabaja tres días en sus recorridos y en su casa todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene varios pedidos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of Grupo De Crédito La Mocora (La Mocora Communal Bank) meet every two weeks in La Mocora, in Colón Parish in Portoviejo, a city known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and ranching. This is where Albina, who is 63 and married, lives. She had eight children from this relationship, one of whom passed away; the other seven are now adults, though one daughter still lives at home. Her husband no longer works due to health problems. 

Doña Albina is a very persistent woman who has always liked working to earn a living. She works in the commercial sector, selling clothing and shoes via catalog. Her sales method is door-to-door. She also recently started selling snacks on weekends, which has been successful. She works making her rounds three days a week, and also works every day from home. She sells her products on credit to her customers and collects the money every week. She has been getting ahead by doing this work for eight years. 

This loan is to purchase supplies to prepare food, as well as to buy clothing and shoes because she has several orders. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes because the loans help her to get ahead. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with four children in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Wilma is 34 years old now.

Wilma has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

Wilma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yahaya, Bitrus, and Suzana.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to serve her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, eliminating the need to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelita is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 48 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Carolina works very hard to provide for them.

Carolina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, candies, etc.

Carolina has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, candies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 42 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Peter Goma

texts.en:
Peter Goma is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Peter Goma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Peace, Faith and Danlami.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Peter Goma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Peter Goma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Peter Goma  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Floripa Aurelia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Floripa, tiene 56 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cinco hijos pero uno falleció, cuatro son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Floripa es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace todo lo posible para que a su familia no les falte nada y aun mas después de la muerte de su querido esposo, ella tiene un deposito  en su casa donde vende agua, colas y varias bebidas mas, ella también en la época invernal siembra con la ayuda de sus hijos maíz, maní y verduras, razón por lo cual está solicitando este crédito ya que necesita arreglar los terrenos que va a sembrar ya que el invierno se acerca y espera tener todo listo para sembrar sus cultivos, con esto y sus ventas ella se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua, colas y para preparar los terrenos para la siembra. Esta desde el inicio  en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the La Mocora credit group meet in the neighborhood of La Mocora, Colon parish, Portoviejo city, a place known for its hardworking people.  The people there work in agriculture and cattle.

This is where Floripa lives.  She is 56 years old.  Her husband died some years back, and she was left a widow.  She had five children from her marriage, but one of them has passed away.  The four children are all adults; two of them still live with her.

Floripa is a very hardworking woman who does whatever she can so that her family lacks for nothing, especially after her husband’s death.  She has a small store in her home where she sells water, soda, and various other drinks.  In the winter season she also plants corn, peanuts, and vegetables with the help of her children.  

She is asking for this loan because she needs to fix up the land she is going to plant.  Winter is approaching and she hopes to have everything ready to sow her crops.  Between this and her sales she earns her living.  She is going to use this loan to buy water and soda, and to prepare her land for planting.  She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help the loans bring her.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy water and soda and to prepare her land for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar de mas cerdos y así poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Because she is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area, the face of this young woman is blurred.  She has worked for a number of years raising pigs.  She sells the pigs in the various markets.  With her sales she manages to get ahead with the household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her partner.  

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more pigs and, in this way, to keep raising the pigs and making better profits.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 45 years old.

Lorena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lorena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Angelina is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Angelina has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 32 years old and married with two children in school. Annalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Annalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Annalyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages.

loans.name: Hanatu

texts.en:
Hanatu is a maize farmer from Galadima Toka village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hanatu has to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hanatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hanatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Faupo

texts.en:
Faupo is 66 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. 

Faupo has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, flour, oil, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Faupo will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, flour, oil, yeast.

loans.name: Leila Indalecia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Leila, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, su hija menor aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.
Doña Leila es una mujer que le gusta sentirse independiente y ganar sus propios ingresos que los utiliza en su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo,  zapatillas, cortinas, sabanas y varios productos más, ella siempre busca lo que este de temporada para que tengan más salida, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. 
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, zapatillas, sabanas, cortinas, entre otras cosas  que ella vende. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
In La Mocora locality of Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo -- a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising -- members of the Grupo De Crédito La Mocora meet every 15 days.

Here lives Leila, a 53 year old woman who is married and has 3 adult children, plus her youngest daughter who still lives with her. Her husband is a professional driver.  

Leila is a woman who likes to feel independent and earn her own income to use in her home.  She is engaged in commerce, selling clothing of all kinds, shoes, curtains, blankets and various other products.  She always searches for what is in season in order to gain more sales. She sells door to door but also sells from her home where customers come when she has new merchandise.  She works every day offering credit to her customers and collecting payments weekly.  She has been in this business for 14 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy shirts, blouses, shoes, sheets, curtains, in addition to other things she sells.  She is a founding member of the Grupo De Crédito and likes it because the loans are very helpful.  Her dreams are moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, shoes, sheets, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Arturo

texts.es: Francisco tiene 38 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Francisco is 38 and lives with his wife and his three children. He owns a metal shop, he makes doors, balconies, and grills amongst other things. He has been doing this for 15 years and so he has lots of experience which helps him improve his work every day. He has many customers as they look for him because of the quality of his work, for his affordable prices and especially because he always carries out the work to his customers' taste. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow him to buy iron, metal, tools etc. so that he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal. tools, etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Linda is 50 years old now.

Linda has a processed food business in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Linda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rufa is 58 years old now.

Rufa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rufa requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rufa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rufa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jasmin works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a recreation center. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, etc. in her general store business.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julieta is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Julieta has a charcoal making business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut shells for her charcoal making.

Julieta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for her charcoal making.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Maria has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods.

loans.name: Jenelle

texts.en:
Jenelle is 43 years old and married with five children in school. Jenelle works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes, etc.

Jenelle has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Jenelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Editha is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her fishing business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijo y su madre, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricela is 37 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children and her mother. She has earned her living for several years by making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn by the quintal and lime powder in order to be able to continue making tortillas. Then she will be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Amioga

texts.en:
Amioga is a 54-year-old married woman with 9 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, beans, cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Amioga has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, seeds, knives, fertilizers etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. 

With her profits, Amioga hopes to extend her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, seeds, knives, fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristal

texts.en:
Cristal is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristal is 28 years old and one of her children is in school.

Cristal has a fruits and vegetables selling business in the Philippines. Cristal requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy food to sell like vegetables, fruits, and more.

Cristal has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Cristal would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. 

Merlinda is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, groceries, etc. for her general store.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Guillerma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Guillerma has been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maria Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maria Arlyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Maria Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Corazon is 54 years old now.

Corazon has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine.

Corazon has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a barquillos-making business in the Philippines. (Barquillos are a rolled wafer cookie.)

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her barquillos-making business

Rhoda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rhoda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her barquillos-making business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Liza is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her banana farming business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de obras artesanales como las que muestra en la fotografía desde hace 5 años, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura y barniz, y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
For five years, this young man (whose face has been pixelated because he is 26 years old) has earned his living making and selling artisanal pieces like those shown in the photograph. His clientele has grown large because of the quality of his work.

The young man lives with his family group in a house that they own. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy clay, paint, and varnish so that he can continue with his work in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, and varnish

loans.name: Pina

texts.en: Pina is 47 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows kava (Samoan ava) that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Pina needs a loan to buy rakes, a wheelbarrow, plastic bags, fertilizers, spades, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Pina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's school fees and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, rakes, plastic bags, fertilizers. spades, etc.

loans.name: Turatbek

texts.ru: Туратбек, 37 лет, женат, отец 2 детей. У Туратбека среднее образование, уже много лет он занимается животноводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря его упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 2 лошади и 24 овцы. Туратбек хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства он приобретет одну лошадь и 6 овец. Туратбек является членом группы "Жетиген", в которой кроме него состоят еще 2 человека. На доходы от кредита Туратбек хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем построить сарай.
texts.en: Turatbek is 37 years old, married and a father of 2 children. Turatbek has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for many years. Having been able to develop his business, thanks to his persistence and drive, today he has 3 cows, 2 horses and 24 sheep. Turatbek wants to continue increasing his livestock headcount and, due to this, requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a another horse and 6 sheep. Turatbek is a member of the "Jetigen" group that, besides him, consists of two more persons. Turatbek wants to increase his livestock headcount and build a barn in the future with the earnings from this loan.

loans.use: to buy another horse and six sheep in order to invest in this business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 43 years old and married with six children in school. Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, biscuits, etc.

Edita has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Edita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, biscuits.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina se levanta todas las mañanas para preparar la comida que ofrece en su negocio, su compañero le apoya bastante. Tiene tres hijos aun en edad escolar y hace tres años se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas también parte del día lo dedica a sus labores como domestica particular. Desde muy joven comenzó en el negocio de realización y comercialización de comida junto a su mama luego vio la oportunidad de independizarse y estableció su propio negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar carne, pollo y bebidas variadas. Dentro de sus planes futuros está remodelar el local para brindarles una mejor imagen a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Each morning Maria Cristina gets up to prepare the meals that she offers in her business.  Her partner helps her quite a bit.  She has three children who are still in school.  

For the past three years she has been working selling food and drinks.  For part of each day she also goes out as a domestic worker.  She was very young when, together with her mom, she began her business making and selling meals.  Later she saw her opportunity to head out on her own and establish her own business.  

She is asking for a loan to buy meat, chicken, and various drinks.  Among her future plans is remodeling her stand in order to present a better image to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, and various beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling Avon products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more Avon products to sell to customers.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, etc. for her general store business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 55 years old and married.  She has four children. With one child in school, Liberty works very hard to provide for them.  Liberty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc..

Liberty has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Liberty would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maribec

texts.en:
Maribec is 37 years old and married.  She has seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maribec is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribec has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Seyitkul

texts.ru: Сейиткул, 56 лет, женат, дети взрослые, есть внуки. У Сейиткула средне-специальное образование, он с 1996 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сейиткула, на данный момент в его хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 18 овец. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют скот на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Сейиткул является участником группы "Жетиген", в которой кроме него состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Seyitkul is 56 years old, married, has adult children and now grandchildren. Seyitkul has a specialized secondary education and, to provide additional income for his family, is involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to Seyitkul's hard work, at the present time his farm contains 2 cows, 2 calves and 18 sheep. Hay and feed have been prepared for the livestock, and in the summer, the livestock is herded to a pasture. His monthly income amounts to about 25,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business, Seyitkul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 10 sheep. Seyitkul is a member of the "Jetigen" group that, besides him, consists of two more persons. He plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further expanding his business and also wants to save money to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús  está en su Segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de ellas es la señora Carmen es vendedora de prendas varias, y de esa forma tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus demás seres queridos, Carmen es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named Divino Niño Jesús is in the second cycle of the Women’s Committee program.  They are also in the Elimination of Poverty program, as a way to improve their own and their families’ living conditions.

Carmen is one of these women.  She is a vendor of clothing, and in this way she has the means to be able to help her family and other loved ones.  Carmen is a person who is working hard to get ahead and to be someone in life.

She is asking for this loan to buy various outfits.  With them she will be able to continue with the sales she has coming up.  She is thankful for the opportunity she has; it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy outfits to sell

loans.name: Suitupu

texts.en: "Suitupe is a 48 year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Suitupe needs a loan to buy gas, boxes of chickens, box of sausages, containers, soy sauce, bag of garlic, bag of onions, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies. Suitupe has been a member of SPBD since 2010."

loans.use: to buy gas, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, bag of garlic, bag of onions, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wooden platforms wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Luis is 57 years old and lives in his own home with his family group. He has an auto repair and paint business located in his residence. With what he makes from his job, he is able to take care of some of his home expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan for the purchase of paint, varnish, oils, and other tools to continue his work and be able to obtain higher earnings to give his family a better quality of live without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase paint, varnish, oil, and other tools.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Rosanna has been in this business for five years. Rosanna earns additional income from food vending.

Rosanna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an ice candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish and pig fattening businesses. Lucila is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making ice candy.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and vegetable vending businesses. Greta is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Greta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gina Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Gina Jean is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gina Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She plans to use her profits to build the business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement mise en place le 23 mars 2007, est composé de femmes qui en plus des liens de bon voisinage ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois  une solidarité entre elles en plus de leurs activités génératrices de revenues qui tournent principalement autour du petit commerce.

Madame Maïmouna (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère  de 08 enfants (04 filles et 04 garçons). C’est une femme d’une détermination solide dans la gestion de ses activités de vente de produits alimentaires : sucre, huile végétale  et divers condiments. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années et a une bonne expérience du domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 03 sacs de sucre revendu par détail par sachet et 02  bidons d’huile végétale de 20 litres. 

Elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et acheter un à deux brebis pour l’élevage.
texts.en:
This group, put together on March 23, 2007, is composed of women, who are not only neighbors, but who were able to develop a solidarity between them since the creation of the “banc villageois,” in addition to their businesses, which are primarily small businesses.

Mrs. Maïmouna (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of this group. She is a 42-year-old married mother of eight (four girls and four boys). This is a woman with a solid determination in the management of her business in food products: sugar, vegetable oil, and diverse seasonings. She has been running this business for several years and has a lot of experience in this domain.

With her new loan, she plans to buy three sacks of sugar to be sold at retail and two 20-liter containers of vegetable oil. 

She plans to use her profits to improve her family’s living conditions and to buy one or two ewes to raise.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of sugar to be sold at retail and two 20-liter containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 34year-old  married woman living in Mcarthur, Dulag, Leyte.  She engages in selling frozen goods like meat and chicken. She is married and has two dependents, ages 10 and 6 year old respectively. Her husband works as a driver. She has been engaged in this kind of business for a year.

Jenelyn is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP  to buy additional stocks of frozen goods. With these, Jenelyn would sell more frozen goods and eventually cater to more customers' needs. This could improve her earnings and pay for healthy food and provide better living conditions.

 Jenelyn dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable for her to finance the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen goods

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Leonila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to to provide herself and her family with an increasing income to uplift their living standards.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nenita works hard to support her family.  She has a personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Kalbu

texts.ru: Калбу, 59 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Калбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки одной нетели. Доходы от кредита Калбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, в будущем планирует построить дом для младшего сына.
texts.en: Kalbu is 59 years old and married. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started 19 years ago with a purchase of livestock. Thanks to Kalbu's hard work, today her farm contains 1 cow, 1 horse and 10 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to increase her livestock headcount by buying another heifer. Kalbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and plans to build a house for her youngest son in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Chary's Group

texts.en: Chary’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chary makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. 
La señora Rafaela es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a vender comestibles que ella misma se encarga de hacer y que después sale a vender. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y comenta que sus clientes le piden mucho sus productos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceite, verduras, carnes para la elaboración de comestibles, lo cual será un medio para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this group make a living from different activities. Each one does her best to get ahead in life.

Rafaela is one of the members. She makes a living by selling food products that she makes. She is a very selfless woman and she says that her clients ask for her products a lot. She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in buying oil, vegetables, and meat to make her food products. This will be a way for her to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy oil, vegetables, and meat for making her food products

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 55 years old and married, with seven grown children, residing in  Mcarthur, Leyte.  

She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She has been raising hogs for seven years already. Her husband is a driver.

Linda has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to  buy three additional pigs and pig feed. This will help  Linda raise and sell more healthy pigs. 

She will continue to manage her hog raising business, which hopefully will lead to the improvement of her livelihood.  Linda  dreams of expanding her current business to be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad elabora antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Maria es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: 35-year-old Maria makes snacks, such as fried potatoes, fried cassava, empanadas, and tamales. She sells them on the streets near her home. Thanks to her sales, she manages to settle the household expenses. Maria is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two daughters. She is asking for financing in order to buy products that she uses to make her snacks, such as: oil, potatoes, maize for the tamales, plantains, and all the ingredients she needs for making her products. In this way, she will be able to continue maintaining her home and to settle any expenses that present themselves.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, maize for tamales, plantains, and all the ingredients she needs to make her products

loans.name: Koy's Group

texts.en:
Koy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Koy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Dieneba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 15 Mai 2009 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même quartier elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Diénaba (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle fait le commerce de porcs qu’elle achète dans son village et environ pour les revendre après engraissement au marché hebdomadaire de Béjein en Guinée Bissau. Elle est assistée par son garçon qui fait le tour des villages à la recherche des porcs.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 10 porcs et 30 000 Fr CFA d’aliment pour engraissement et revente.

Les bénéfices vont servir à  de la nourriture pour la famille, payer les frais de scolarité des enfants et de régler les autres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was assembled on May 15, 2009. The women in the group are all from the same neighborhood and have connections via family or marriage. They are very united and run primarily small businesses. 

Mrs. Diénaba (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of this group. She is a 48-year-old married mother of five, three of which are boys and two of which are girls. She sells pigs that she buys at her village and nearby in order to sell them after fattening them at the weekly market in Béjein in Guinée Bissau. She is helped by her son, who circulates around the villages researching pigs. 

With her loan, she is going to buy ten pigs and 30,000 FCFA of food for fattening and reselling them.
 
The profits will be used to buy food for the family, to pay for the children’s schooling, and to pay for the family’s other needs.

loans.use: to buy ten pigs and 30,000 FCFA of food for fattening and reselling them

loans.name: Naroeurn's Group

texts.en: The members of Naroeurn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naroeurn makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water, so having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en: The members of Chanthoeun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Rceun's Group
