texts.en: The members of Rceun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Rceun makes a living growing rice and supports his family by also doing extra work as tailor and construction worker. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water, so having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Bos's Group

texts.en:
Bos’s groups live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Bos works as farmer to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman to safeguard the health of their family.  They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, sand, and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Don Carlos de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica a la venta de productos lacteos (queso, crema, quesillo) desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de lo productos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 53 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He has been selling dairy products (cheese, cream, farmer's cheese) for the pas 20 years, and he has many clients due to the quality of his products. He is requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale, so as to continue with his sales and make more money.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and farmer's cheese wholesale

loans.name: Nhen's Group

texts.en:
Nhen’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nhen makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the group members to safeguard the health of their family.  They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling  water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: The two members of Nat’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en: The members of Sren’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sren makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Yim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yesenia Monserreate

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Yesenia, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 9  y 5 años de edad,  el mayor estudia en colegio y los  menores en escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.
Doña Yesenia es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora con el hogar, ella realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo con su labor, él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad, allí elabora puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras con el hierro, el trabaja todos los días y siempre está ocupado ya que no le falta trabajo y esto es porque él es muy cumplido con sus clientes y realiza un muy buen trabajo. Ella también en ocasiones le ayuda a su marido en sus actividades.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar hierro, pintura y otros  materiales de cerrajería  para su trabajo. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the La Mocora loan group meet in the La Mocora area of the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. The area is known for its hardworking people, and earns a living through agriculture and livestock.

Yesenia lives in this area. She's 39 years old and is married. From this relationship, she has three children who are 14, nine and five years old. The oldest is in high school and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is an iron worker.

Yesenia is a hardworking and supportive woman at home. She's taking the loan to help her husband with his work. He has a iron workshop in the area where he makes doors, windows and other structure with iron. 

He works every day and is always busy since he doesn't lack work. This is because he's very satisfied with his customers and does a very good job. On occasion, she also helps her husband with his work.

This loan will be used to buy iron, paint and other ironworking materials for their work. She's been in the loan group for five years and likes is because the group is very united. Her goals are to move forward and give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy iron, paint and other ironwork materials.

loans.name: Dorn's Group

texts.en:
Dorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Dorn makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family. They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ceng's Group

texts.en:
Ceng’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Ceng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a village coordinator to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

Rin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
Yoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yoeun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family. They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a farmer from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has two children.

Rebecca has been engaged in corn farming for more than a year now. Rebecca is standing next to sacks of fertilizer. Rebecca works really hard to earn an income through her farming venture.

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer and corn seeds. This will enable her to grow more corn and improve the productivity of her farm.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada. Desde muy joven trabajó para ayudar a su familia, es madre de 4 hijos a quienes ella le ayuda con. Ahora dos de sus hijos ya tienen casa propia con la ayuda de ella. 
Ella es vendedora ambulante, vende  productos varios en diferentes ciudades  a cuotas, cuenta con cobros semanales,  realiza la venta casa por casa con ayuda de su marido. Gracias a su esfuerzo  posee un negocio y casa propia. Actualmente sus hijos siguen el mismo camino realizando la misma actividad en la zona de Carapeguá.
Solicita el préstamo para compra termos, electrodomésticos, muebles, etc., para poder seguir con sus ventas, de manera a seguir con su microemprendimiento.
texts.en: Margarita is a hardworking and dedicated person. She began working from a very young age to help her family. She is the mother of four children, who she helps. Now two of her children have their own homes, with her help. She is a traveling saleswoman, and she sells various products in different cities on credit, receiving weekly payments. She sells house-to-house with the help of her husband. Thanks to her hard work, she has a business and her own house. Her children are now following the same path, selling in the area of Carapeguá. She is requesting this loan to buy coolers, electrical appliances, furniture, etc. so she can continue with her sales and her micro-entrepreneurship.

loans.use: to buy coolers, electrical appliances, furniture, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amaranta Alegria

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Amaranta, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Amaranta es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus actividades, su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y varios productos más, el viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil llevando frutas que compra en la zona, queso, maní molido y varios productos más que vende a muy buen precio,  el  también trabaja en una volqueta y utiliza el crédito para comprar material pétreo el cual junto con el trasporte cobra a sus clientes que le piden que les realice estos viajes.  El realiza estas actividades desde hace más de 20 años y es así como se gana el sustento diario de toda la familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, queso, maní y material pétreo. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.
texts.en:
In La Mocora of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and ranching, the members of the La Mocora Credit Group meet every two weeks.

Amaranta lives in this place. She is 59 years old and has a common law marriage, from which she has three adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Amaranta is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband, takes out loans so that he can use them for his business. Her husband makes his living selling fruits and various other products. He travels to the city of Guayaquil, taking fruits that he buys in the area, cheese, ground peanuts, and various other products that he sells at a very good price.

He also drives a dump truck and uses the loan to buy gravel, which, along with transport, he charges to his customers who request the delivery. He has been doing these activities for more than 20 years, and this is how he earns his family's daily bread.

This loan is to buy fruits, cheese, peanuts, and gravel. She has been with the credit group for three years, and she likes it for the benefits the Bank gives. Her dream is to have a small grocery store in her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits, cheese, peanuts, and gravel.

loans.name: Sal's Group

texts.en:
Sal’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sal makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hoeurng makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these two women and a man to safeguard the health of their family.. They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ok's Group

texts.en: The members of Ok’s group live in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Ok makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a tailor, to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en: The members of Pich’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Pich makes a living cultivating rice, and he does extra work as a tailor and a seller of groceries at home, to support his family. In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Abundio

texts.en:
Abundio is a 24-year-old, single man, who provides motor transport services in his community. He works on the family-owned farm, too, for a living. His farm is doing well, and with the increased income from this he was able to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle.

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC. He will use it to cover motorcycle repair costs, buying motor accessories and body parts, for better and safer services. He wants to have a comfortable house, and he wants to improve and expand his transportation business, in the near future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle repair costs, buying motor accessories and body parts, for better and safer services.

loans.name: Gagau

texts.en:
Gagau is a 58 years old and married, with eight children. 

She has a small garden and grows Samoan tobacco to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Gagau has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, fillings,and an axe.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Gagau hopes to build up a new house and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knivies, seeds, fillings, and an axe.

loans.name: Rarotonga

texts.en:
Rarotonga 45 years old and married, with eight children. 

She runs a small business selling cucumbers, cabbages, tomatoes, and beans in her community, and she has been doing this for four years. 

Rarotonga has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 211 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rarotonga hopes to continue doing her business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en: The members of Sreymao’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Sreymao makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a tailor, to support her family. In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Pheak's Group

texts.en: The members of Pheak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Pheak makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a tailor, to support her family. In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter and provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita earns a living by selling vegetables to the local people in her community. She sells green leafy vegetables such as pechay, making a living by selling camote tops, kangkong (water spinach), squash, and bottle gourd.

She has been engaged in vegetable vending for ten years. She and her husband have seven grown children. Together with her family, she lives in McArthur, Leyte.

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional stock such as pechay, bananas, upo (gourd), and squash. In this way, Nenita could buy and display a variety of vegetables that would attract more consumers to purchase.

Nenita is hoping that someday her livelihood will be productive and profitable, as well as stabilize her daily earnings.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as pechay, bananas, upo (gourd), and squash.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a father of a two-year-old baby girl.  He is 26 years old, residing in Mcarthur, Leyte. 

He earns his livelihood by engaging in the food vending business. He makes and sells puto -- a steamed rice cake that can be eaten alone as a snack, typically flavored with cheese or butter.  He has been engaged in this kind of business for three years already.

Rafael  is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 supplies like flour, sugar, and yeast, and for additional capital to restart his ice cream business.  He could produce more rice cakes to sell and hopefully try his best at restarting his ice cream business. 

In this way, his earnings will improve, and probably he can provide his family with healthy diets and better living conditions.

He is hoping that he could manage both his businesses productively for the welfare of his growing child.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, and yeast  and to obtain capital to restart his ice cream business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda works hard to support her family. She is married and engaged in a business, buying and selling rice, in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Belinda has been in this business for four years, now.

In the future, Belinda would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 66 years old and widowed. She has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Leonila has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Leonila aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business, buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase a larger stock of nipa roofing to sell. Daisy has been in this business for three years.

In the future Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a larger stock of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business, buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Margie has been in this business for five years, now.

In the future, Margie would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dewanie

texts.en:
Dewanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Dewanie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is listing Dewanie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Samoun's Group

texts.en:
Samoun’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Samoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, a la vez que estudia, también está trabajando. Comenta que su meta es llegar a ser una profesional y culminar sus estudios para de esa forma poder ser útil a su familia y su comunidad.
Ella es una persona muy idealista, que se encuentra estudiando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y también poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir tras sus sueños y sus metas.
texts.en:
Mariela is from the city of Paraguarí. She is studying and working at the same time. Mariela says that her goal is to become a professional. By finishing her studies, she will become useful to her family and her community.

Mariela is a person who is very idealistic. She is studying so that she can make something of her life and also help other people in society.

Mariela is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue pursuing her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from her rice-farming and pig-fattening businesses.

Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell, for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edilyn is 34 years old and married, with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Edilyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for 13 years and also earns an income from fish-vending.

Edilyn aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 40 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, selling dry goods in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, like blankets, pillow cases, t-shirts, blouses, etc. Chona has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Chona would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like blankets, pillow cases, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Corsina

texts.en:
Corsina is 27 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is currently in school. Corsina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, beer, canned goods, snack foods, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, and so on.

Corsina has been in this business for 10 years. She sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, beer, canned goods, snack foods, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, etc. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, beer, canned goods, snack foods, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salon chairs for haircuts and for waxing, as well as massage tables

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun (pictured here) is 27 years old, single, and lives with her family, at Ang Snoul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. Hun has been a garment worker for Yu Yi Cambodia Co., Ltd., at Kandal province, for two years, Now she would like to apply for a loan to purchase a new motorbike, for riding to her work place. Nowadays, she goes to work with her friend.

She said that she can earn money to pay back and can save some money for support of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to take to work.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. Josephine has been in this business for 12 years, now. She successfully repaid her previous loans, and now she has requested another loan, to further build her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store, like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 15 Mai 2009 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du groupement du même quartier. Elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle marié, âgée de 53 ans et mère de 01 garçon et 02 filles âgés de 12 à 20 ans. Elle gère une cantine où elle vend des légumes frais et divers produits au marché central. Elle s’approvisionne à Dakar auprès de grossiste pour la revente au détail. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois ainsi que dans son activité. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10  sacs d’oignon, 02 cartons d’épices et  environ 200 kg de divers légumes et condiments.

 Les bénéfices servent à acheter de la nourriture et payer la scolarité des enfants et de réaliser un habitat pour la famille.
texts.en:
This group was inaugurated on 15th May 2009. The women of this group all come from the same district and all know each other through the bonds of family and community. They present a united front and earn their livelihoods through small-scale retail activities.

Fatou (the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a 53-year-old married mother to one son and two daughters aged between 12 and 20 years old. She runs her own canteen at the central market where she sells fresh vegetables and various other items. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Dakar which she then sells on at a profit. She has a great deal of experience with the banc villageois system and with running her own business. 

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing 10 sacks of onions, two boxes of spices and around 200 kilos of various vegetables and condiments. 

The profits will be used to purchase food, pay for her children's school fees and create a homestead for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of onions, two boxes of spices and around 200 kilos of various vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Villa Itaipu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villa Itaipu  está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como medio para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de ellas es la señora Neide, ella se destaca por ser una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, es peluquera y esta luchando por ir creciendo día a día. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y que no se cansa de luchar, todo esto para un mejor futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y captar también nuevos. agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group Villa Itaipu is in its first cycle with the women's community bank program. It is a new group that hopes to be able to improve its living conditions and be able to grow and get ahead. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey as a way to improve their lives.

One of the members is Neide who stands out as a woman who is very self-sacrificing and who struggles to give her family that which she did not have. She is a hairdresser and is struggling to grow day by day. She does not tire of fighting so that she can have a better future. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, etc. so she can continue to provide good service to her customers and attract new ones too. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, etc. for use in a hair salon.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En total son 23 mujeres inspiradas que trabajan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar  además de sostener la idea de aumentar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por crecer y ser mejores cada día.
La Sra. Maria, ella está  contenta,  se siente motivada  por formar parte del comité. Comenta que logró emprender una actividad para ganar dinero, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles que lo hace de manera constante y sobre pedidos. Cuenta que ya maneja varios clientes de la zona, mediante eso ella y su familia están aumentando sus   ingresos y mejoran su condición de vida y la de de su familia. 
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
There are a total of 23 inspired women who work day by day to cover their household expenses as well as to try to increase their income to help their families. These women are heads of household who struggle to grow and improve themselves every day.

Maria is content and was motivated to join the committee. She states that she was able to start an activity to earn money, and today she prepares food by order and for general sale. She comments that she now has a number of customers from her zone and that this has allowed her to increase her income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Maria is asking for this loan so she can buy various supplies for making her meals, such as greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, etc. and continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, etc. to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio Rojas

texts.es:
Rogelio Rojas tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y sus cuatro menores hijos de 17, 15, 13, 11 de los cuales el primero y el segundo cursa secundaria y los otros primaria en colegio nacional, Rogelio Rojas es natural de la zona, tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. y está ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Rogelio Rojas es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafe, ubicado en el caserío Naranjitos, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto a un buen precio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio Rojas is 43 years old and lives in his own home made of traditional rustic materials. He lives with his wife and four children ages 17, 15, 13, and 11 years old. The two oldest are in high school and the others in elementary school. Rogelio Rojas is originally from this area. He has good personal and work references. People in his community work primarily in agriculture, raising cattle, and business. He is located in Pomahuaca district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.

Rogelio Rojas is a farmer. He grows coffee in the Naranjitos village. He has 10 years of experience. The loan he seeks will be used to pay for agricultural supplies and chores such as the application of fertilizers and labor for the harvest. In this way his crop will improve physiologically, morphologically, and in production, so he will also have an opportune harvest resulting in greater production of high-quality product which he will not have problems selling at a good price. This will enable him in the short term to improve his income, increase his profits, and finally improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies and chores such as the application of fertilizers and labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 62-year-old farmer, from Ormoc City, Leyte. Esmeralda is married and has three, grown-up children. She grows various crops, like peanuts, pineapple, and others. This is the source of her income. Her husband is also a farmer.

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy more more fertilizer. This loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm, thus allowing her to increase her harvest and profit.

In the future, Esmeralda hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more more fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Lonny

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años y su negocio es la confección de ropa de niña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un sitio caracterizado por el comercio informal y por la manufactura independiente. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que varía entre 21º y 35º grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Ana es de tez trigueña, cabello color castaño largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa familiar que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la confección de ropa infantil para niña, como; vestidos, faldas, pantalones con elástico, etc. “...Nada más fácil que la confección de prendas para niños hasta más o menos los diez años, ya que a partir de esa edad  ya en las niñas su cuerpo comienza a cambiar y necesitan pinzas o adornos para confeccionar la prenda y ajustarla o entallarla al cuerpo…” comenta. su sueño es tener su casa propia, y desea realizar la compra de tela, hilos y otros materiales de trabajo por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de fin de año.
texts.en:
Ana, age 39, is single and has a 12 year old son.  Her business is making girls’ clothes.

She is a good mother.  She is enterprising, independent, tenacious, responsible, and hard-working.  She conducts her business in the area south of the city.  It is a place that is known for its informal commerce and independent manufacturing.  It has a warm, tropical, and humid climate with a temperature that varies between 21º and 35º degrees centigrade during the day and throughout the year.

Ana has a golden-brown complexion with long brown hair that is tied back.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for her business.  She shares her life with her son who goes to school.  They live in a family house that has potable water and electricity.

Her business is making children’s clothes for girls.  She makes things like dresses, skirts, and pants with elastic, etc.  “Nothing is easier than making clothes for children until they are more or less ten years old.  After this age the girl’s body starts to change and they need pleats or decorations to make the garments and to make alterations or to fit it to the body,” she says.

Her dream is to have her own house.  She wishes to buy fabric, thread, and other work materials wholesale in order to supply her customers for the end of the year.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She has been engaged in this business activity for three years.

It is for these reasons that Ana is requesting a loan to buy fabric wholesale in order to supply her customers at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale in order to supply her customers at the end of the year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of laminate and wood and pay for labor to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Nery Alexander

texts.es:
Nery de 33 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja es ama de casa y se encarga de administrar una tienda que inicio con su pareja y que está ubicada en el centro del caserío. 
Nery es agricultor desde pequeño, aprendió trabajando con su padre, cultiva maíz y frijol pero también parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la tienda que inicio con su esposa hace ya dos años.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar bebidas, condimentos y otros productos de cocina, son los que más se venden en esta temporada por estar próxima la navidad y no cuenta con dinero suficiente para comprar debido a los gastos que tuvo cosechando.
El sueño de Nery es proveer siempre a su familia de las cosas necesarias para vivir.
texts.en: Nery is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. His spouse is a housewife and in charge of the store that he opened with his wife that is located in the center of their village. Nery has been farming since childhood, he learned by working with his father. He grows corn and beans but also part of the time works in the store that he opened with his wife two years ago. He seeks a loan to buy beverages, condiments and other kitchen products, which are what he sells the most during this season as Christmas approaches. He doesn't have enough money to buy the products due to the costs that he incurred as he had to harvest crops. Nery dreams of always providing for his family the things they need in order to live.

loans.use: to buy beverages, condiments and other kitchen products.
